Steam (ST): ...What is that sound that always fills my ears? Is it the sound of the rain, the sound of a waterfall, or could it be radio static?
Umineko Project (UP): ......What was the sound that always filled the ears?{n}The sound of the rain, the sound of a waterfall, or was it radio static?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......What was the sound that always filled the ears? The sound of the rain, the sound of a waterfall, or was it radio static?
PC Japanese (JP): ……いつも耳を満たすのは何の音か。雨の音か、滝の音か、それとも無線の砂嵐なのか。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……いつも耳を満たすのは何の音か。{n}雨の音か、滝の音か、それとも無線の砂嵐なのか。
Russian (RU): ......Что это за звук, непрерывно отдающийся в ушах?{n}Звук ли это дождя, водопада, или статических помех радио?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......O que era o som que sempre preenchia meus ouvidos?{n}O som da chuva, o som de uma cachoeira, ou talvez fosse a estática do rádio?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……一刻不停灌滿耳朵的是什麼聲音呢？{n}是雨聲，是瀑布的聲音，還是無線電的噪音呢？
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……一刻不停灌满耳朵的是什么声音呢？{n}是雨声，是瀑布的声音，还是无线电的噪音呢？
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Qual era il suono che mi riempiva sempre le orecchie? Il suono della pioggia, il suono di una cascata, oppure erano le interferenze della radio?
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): ...Qual è il suono che si sente sempre nelle proprie orecchie?{n}Il rumore della pioggia, quello di una cascata, oppure le interferenze della radio?
Turkish (TR): ......Kulaklarımı dolduran bu ses de ne?{n}Yağmur mu, şelale mi, yoksa radyo cızırtısı mı?

Steam (ST): If not, I want it to be the sound of blood flowing through my body. ...I want it to be the sound of the blood circulating throughout me, telling me that I am still alive...
Umineko Project (UP): In that case, I want it to be the sound of blood flowing through the body. ......I want it to be the sound of the blood circulating throughout my body, telling me that I am still alive...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In that case, I want it to be the sound of blood flowing through the body.......I want it to be the sound of the blood circulating throughout my body, telling me that I am still alive...
PC Japanese (JP): ならば血潮の音であってほしい。……まだこの体に血が巡り、私が生き永らえていることを教えてくれる音であってほしい…。
Russian (RU): В любом случае, я бы хотел, чтобы это стало звуком крови, текущей в теле. ......Я хочу, чтобы это был звук крови, циркулирующей по всему моему телу, напоминая мне, что я всё ещё жив...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nesse caso, eu quero que seja o som do sangue fluindo pelo corpo. ......Quero que seja o som do sangue circulando pelo meu corpo, me dizendo que ainda estou vivo...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 若是如此，那我希望它是鮮血澎湃的聲音。……希望它是將血液還在這副軀體裡循環，將我還活著的事實告訴我的聲音…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 若是如此，那我希望它是鲜血澎湃的声音。……希望它是将血液还在这副躯体里循环，将我还活着的事实告诉我的声音…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): In quel caso, voglio che sia il suono del sangue che scorre nel corpo. ... Voglio che sia il suono del sangue che circola attraverso il mio corpo, avvertendomi che sono ancora vivo...
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Se avessi potuto scegliere, avrei voluto udire il suono del sangue che pulsava in me... Volevo udire il sangue scorrere dentro al mio corpo, così da comunicarmi che avrei continuato a vivere...
Turkish (TR): Eğer değilse, vücudumda akan kanın sesi olmasını isterim. ......Bana hâlâ hayatta olduğumu söyleyen, vücudumda dolaşan kanın sesi olmasını istiyorum...

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Hmm... è mattino...?"
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...Mmmh... È... mattina...?"

Steam (ST): The light entering through a crack in the curtain was faint, but it at least told him that dawn had broken.
Umineko Project (UP): The light entering through a crack in the curtain was faint, but it at least told him that dawn had broken.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): カーテンの隙間から入る光は弱々しいが、夜が明けたことだけは教えてくれた。
Russian (RU): Свет, проникающий через щель в занавесе, был слабым, но по крайней мере это говорило ему, что рассвет наступил.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A luz que entrava por uma fresta na cortina era fraca, mas ao menos indicava a ele que já havia amanhecido.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 從窗簾縫隙間射入的陽光雖弱，但至少是讓人知道了已到清晨。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 从窗帘缝隙间射入的阳光虽弱，但至少是让人知道了已到清晨。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): La luce che entrava da un'apertura nella tenda era fievole, ma gli rivelò almeno che la notte era finita.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): La luce che entrava dallo spiraglio delle tende era flebile, ma lo avvisò della venuta dell'alba.
Turkish (TR): Perdedeki aralıktan içeriye vuran ışık zayıftı ama hiç değilse ona güneşin doğduğunu söylüyordu.

Steam (ST): Kinzo, still in the position he'd been when he woke up, ...still sitting in a chair and looking up at the ceiling, ...felt the blood slowly travel throughout his body...
Umineko Project (UP): Kinzo, still in the same pose he had when he awoke, ...still sitting in his chair and looking up at the ceiling, ...felt the blood slowly travel throughout his body...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Kinzo, still acting like one who has just woken up, ...still sitting in a chair and looking up at the ceiling..., felt the blood slowly travel throughout his body...
PC Japanese (JP): 金蔵は、目覚めた時の姿勢のまま、…椅子に座り天上を見上げた姿勢のまま…、全身に血をゆっくりと巡らせて行く…。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 金蔵は、目覚めた時の姿勢のまま、…椅子に座り天井を見上げた姿勢のまま…、全身に血をゆっくりと巡らせて行く…。
Russian (RU): Кинзо, по‐прежнему вёл себя как только что проснувшийся человек ...всё ещё сидя на кресле и глядя в потолок... ощущал, как медленно кровь движется в его теле...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Kinzo, ainda na mesma pose em que estava quando acordou, ...ainda sentado em sua cadeira e olhando para o teto, ...sentiu o sangue lentamente viajar pelo seu corpo...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 金藏保持著剛醒來時的姿勢，…保持著躺在椅子上望著天花板的姿勢…，讓血液慢慢地循環到全身…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 金藏保持着刚醒来时的姿势，…保持着躺在椅子上望着天花板的姿势…，让血液慢慢地循环到全身…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Kinzo, ancora agendo come uno se si fosse appena svegliato... stando ancora seduto su una sedia e guardando il soffitto... sentì il sangue scorrere lentamente attraverso il suo corpo...
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Mentre Kinzo era ancora nella stessa posizione in cui si era svegliato... rimasto seduto su una sedia, con lo sguardo rivolto in alto... a mano a mano, il suo sangue fluì lentamente in tutto il suo corpo...
Turkish (TR): Kinzo, hâlâ uyandığı andaki pozisyonunda, ...koltuğunda oturmuş tavana bakarken, ...kanının vücudunda yavaşça dolaştığını hissediyordu...

Steam (ST): ...Judging by the clock, it was early morning, 6:00 on the dot. ...No matter how tired he was, no matter how deeply he slept, he always woke up at exactly this time, as though he had measured it with an hourglass.
Umineko Project (UP): ...Judging by the clock, it was early morning, six on the dot. ......No matter how tired he was, no matter how deeply he slept, he woke up at exactly this time, as though he had measured it with an hourglass.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Judging by the clock, it was early morning, 6:00 on the dot.......No matter how tired he was, no matter how deeply he slept, he woke up at exactly this time, as though he had measured it with an hourglass.
PC Japanese (JP): …時計を見ると早朝、６時ぴったり。……どれだけ疲れていようとも、どれだけ深く眠っていようとも、まるで砂時計で計ったかのようにぴたりとこの時間に目覚める。
Russian (RU): ...Судя по часам, было раннее утро, шесть часов ровно. ......Несмотря на то, насколько усталым он был, несмотря на то, как глубоко он спал, он просыпался ровно в это время, словно измерял его песочными часами.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Julgando pelo relógio, era de manhã cedo, seis em ponto. ......Não importava o quão cansado ele estivesse, não importava o quão profundamente ele dormisse, ele sempre acordava nessa mesma hora, como se ele a tivesse medido com uma ampulheta.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …看了下時鐘，正好是早上六點。……無論有多累，無論睡得有多深，他都會恰好在仿彿是被沙漏計算好的此時醒來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …看了下时钟，正好是早上六点。……无论有多累，无论睡得有多深，他都会恰好在仿佛是被沙漏计算好的此时醒来。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... A giudicare dall'orologio, era mattino presto, le 6:00 in punto. ... Per quanto fosse stanco, per quanto avesse dormito profondamente, si svegliava sempre a quest'ora precisa, come se l'avesse misurata con una clessidra.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Guardando l'orologio, era un orario mattutino: le sei, ad essere precisi... Non importava quanto fosse stanco o quanto avesse dormito profondamente, si svegliava sempre a quest'ora esatta, come se l'avesse determinata con una clessidra.
Turkish (TR): ...Saate bakılırsa daha sabahın erken saatleriydi, 6:00. ......Ne kadar yorgun olursa olsun, ne kadar derin uyursa uyusun, sanki bir kum saatine bağlıymış gibi tam bu saatte uyanırdı.

Steam (ST): He didn't think of this as something to boast about, but he told himself that, as long as he could still manage this, his health couldn't be that bad.
Umineko Project (UP): He didn't think that something like this was worthy of boasting of, but he told himself that while he could still do something like this, he was still in robust health.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): He didn't think that something like this would lead him to boast, but he instructed himself that while he could still do something like this, he was still in robust health.
PC Japanese (JP): こんなことが自慢になるとは思っていないが、その程度のことができる内は、自分はまだまだ強健なのだと自分に言い聞かせていた。
Russian (RU): Он не думал, что ему стоит гордиться чем‐то подобным, но настроил себя, что если его хватает на подобное, значит он ещё достаточно здоров.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ele não pensava nisso como algo para se gabar, mas disse a si mesmo que enquanto ainda conseguisse fazer algo assim, ainda teria uma saúde robusta.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然並不覺得這值得驕傲，但他告訴自己，在身體還能做到這種程度時，自己還是很硬朗的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然并不觉得这值得骄傲，但他告诉自己，在身体还能做到这种程度时，自己还是很硬朗的。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Non pensava che qualcosa del genere l'avrebbe portato a vantarsi, ma confidò a se stesso che finché riusciva a fare cose di questo tipo, aveva ancora una salute di ferro.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Non pensava che fosse qualcosa di cui vantarsi, ma ripeteva a se stesso che, finché sarebbe stato così preciso, aveva ancora una salute di ferro.
Turkish (TR): Böyle bir şeyin övünülecek bir şey olmadığını düşünüyordu ama kendi kendine hâlâ böyle bir şey yapabiliyorsa sağlığının yerinde olduğunu söylüyordu.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Steam (ST): "......Morning has come, which means... ......hmmm. ...It would appear I've avoided becoming one of the first sacrifices. ...Was I merely lucky when the roulette was spun, ...or is this the fruit of my efforts? How irritating that I cannot tell the difference, but I mustn't be bothered by such trivialities."
Umineko Project (UP): ".........Morning has come, which means... ...............Hmmm. ......It seems that I've escaped being one of the first sacrifices. ......Was the result of the roulette fortunate, ...or is this the fruit of my efforts? It is irritating that I cannot tell the difference, but I will not say that."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........Morning has come, which means...............hmmm. ......In any event, it seems that I've escaped being one of the first sacrifices. ......Was the result of the roulette fortunate, ...or is this the fruit of my efforts? It is irritating that I cannot tell the difference, but I will not say that."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………朝を迎えた、ということは…。……………ふむ。……どうやら、最初の生贄は逃れたということらしい。……ルーレットの目が幸運だったのか、…我が努力の賜物なのか、区別の付かぬところが何とももどかしいが、それは言うまい。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………朝を迎えた、ということは…。……………ふむ。……どうやら、最初の生贄は逃れたということらしい。……ルーレットの目が幸運だったのか、…我が努力の賜物なのか、区別の付かぬところが何とももどかしいが、それは言うまい」
Russian (RU): ".........Утро наступило, а это значит... Хм‐м. ......В любом случае похоже, что я не оказался в числе первых жертв. ......Это результат удачи в рулетке... Или же это плод моих усилий? Так досадно, что я не могу определить разницу, но я не собираюсь рассуждать об этом."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........A manhã chegou, o que significa... ...............Hmmm. ......Parece que escapei de ser um dos primeiros sacrifícios. ......Tive sorte no resultado da roleta, ...ou este é o fruto dos meus esforços? É irritante que eu não consiga perceber a diferença, mas não ficarei comentando sobre isso."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………迎來了早晨，那就代表著…。……………哼嗯。……看來，我似乎是逃過了最初的活祭。……是輪盤賭的結果足夠幸運呢，…還是拜我的努力所賜呢，雖然辨不出這原因實在令人煩心，但不提也罷。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………迎来了早晨，那就代表着…。……………哼嗯。……看来，我似乎是逃过了最初的活祭。……是轮盘赌的结果足够幸运呢，…还是拜我的努力所赐呢，虽然辨不出这原因实在令人烦心，但不提也罢。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... È arrivato il mattino, ciò significa che... hmmm. ... In ogni caso, sembra che sia riuscito a non diventare uno dei primi sacrifici. ... L'esito della roulette è stato fortunato... o è il frutto dei miei sforzi? È irritante che non riesca a comprendere la differenza, ma non lo rivelerò."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...Si è fatta mattina, il che significa... Mmmh... Ad ogni modo, sembra che io sia scampato dal diventare uno dei primi sacrifici. L'esito della roulette è dovuto alla fortuna... o è il risultato dei miei sforzi? Non lo ammetterò mai, ma è alquanto frustrante non riuscire a discernere la differenza."
Turkish (TR): ".........Sabah oldu, bu demek oluyor ki... ...............Hmmm. ......Görünüşe göre ilk kurbanlardan biri olmaktan kurtuldum. ......Ruletin şanslı bir sonucu muydu, ...yoksa çabalarımın meyvesi mi? Aradaki farkı anlayamamak rahatsız edici, ama böyle önemsiz şeyleri düşünmemeliyim."

Steam (ST): Kinzo was struck by a faint desire to see beyond the study door.
Umineko Project (UP): Kinzo was very slightly driven by a temptation to look at the other side of the study door.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Kinzo was very slightly driven by a temptation to see the outside of the study door.
PC Japanese (JP): 金蔵は、書斎の扉の外側を見てみたい誘惑に少しだけ駆られた。
Russian (RU): Кинзо поборол лёгкое искушение выглянуть за пределы двери кабинета.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Kinzo foi ligeiramente tomado pela tentação de olhar do outro lado da porta de seu estúdio.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 金藏被想看看書房門外側的誘惑惹得有點心動。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 金藏被想看看书房门外侧的诱惑惹得有点心动。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Kinzo era leggermente tentato di vedere l'esterno del suo studio.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Kinzo fu leggermente tentato di guardare fuori dalla porta del suo studio.
Turkish (TR): Kinzo, çalışma odasının kapısının diğer tarafına bakma isteğiyle yanıp tutuşuyordu.

Steam (ST): After all, he might find the traces of someone's vain struggle to break through the door, a sign that someone had tried to select him as one of the first six sacrifices.
Umineko Project (UP): Because he thought that maybe he might find the traces of a vain struggle to break the door, made by something trying to select him as one of the first six sacrifices.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Because he thought that maybe, he might find the traces of a vain struggle to break the door, made by something trying to select him as one of the first six sacrifices.
PC Japanese (JP): ひょっとすると、最初の６人の生贄に自分を選ぼうとして、この扉を破ろうと悪足掻きした痕跡が見つけられるかもしれないと思ったからだ。
Russian (RU): Поскольку он думал, что вероятно обнаружит следы тщетных усилий выломать дверь — что нечто намеревалось выбрать его одной из шести жертв.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Afinal, ele pensou que talvez pudesse se deparar com o traços de uma luta vã para quebrar a porta, feita por algo tentando selecioná‐lo como um dos seis primeiros sacrifícios.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這是因為他心想，搞不好在門上會發現，為把自己選為最初的六名活祭之一，而留下的嘗試破門的痕跡。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这是因为他心想，搞不好在门上会发现，为把自己选为最初的六名活祭之一，而留下的尝试破门的痕迹。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Perché pensava che forse, avrebbe potuto trovare le tracce un vano tentativo di rompere la porta, fatto da qualcosa che provava a sceglierlo come uno pei primi sei sacrifici.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Questo perché credeva che avrebbe potuto rinvenire le tracce di un vano tentativo di sfondare la porta, compiuto in modo da sceglierlo come uno dei primi sei sacrifici.
Turkish (TR): Çünkü belki de kendisini ilk altı kurbandan biri olarak seçmeye gelen bir varlığın, kapıdan geçebilmek için verdiği beyhude mücadelenin izlerini bulabileceğini düşündü.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Steam (ST): "...Hmph. ......Humans are cheap creatures. ...Even though everything is ultimately decided by God, when humans are given good fortune, they arrogantly feel it was due to their own ability."
Umineko Project (UP): "...Hmph. .........Humans are cheap creatures. ......They claim to do their best and leave the rest to Providence, yet when they are given good fortune, they desire to flatter themselves that it arose not from simple luck, but from their own ability."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "...Hmph. .........Humans are cheap creatures. ......While they concern themselves with other's affairs and possess sacred life, they want to love themselves, and when they are given good fortune, they say that it was due to their own ability rather than simple good fortune."
PC Japanese (JP): 「…ふ。………人間とは安っぽい生き物だな。……人事を尽くして天命を待ちながら、幸運を得られた時には、それが単なる幸運ではなく、己の技量に拠るものだったと自惚れたくもなる。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…ふ。………人間とは安っぽい生き物だな。……人事を尽くして天命を待ちながら、幸運を得られた時には、それが単なる幸運ではなく、己の技量に拠るものだったと自惚れたくもなる」
Russian (RU): "...Хмф. .........Люди — низкие существа. ......В то время как они интересуются чужими делами и обладают священной жизнью, они слишком самолюбивы, и когда им достаётся удача, они говорят, что так сложилось благодаря их собственным способностям, а не простой удаче."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...Hmph. .........Humanos são criaturas baratas. ......Eles afirmam fazerem seu melhor e deixam o resto à Divina Providência, ainda assim, quando recebem a boa sorte, desejam se gabar de que isso não se deve à simples sorte, mas à sua própria habilidade."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…哼。………人類真是一種膚淺的生物。……一邊盡著人事聽著天命，可在獲得了幸運之時，卻又自鳴得意地希望這不光是幸運，更是憑了自己的本事才有的。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…哼。………人类真是一种肤浅的生物。……一边尽着人事听着天命，可在获得了幸运之时，却又自鸣得意地希望这不光是幸运，更是凭了自己的本事才有的。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Hmph. ... Gli umani sono creature insignificanti. ... Mentre posseggono una vita sacra e si preoccupano dei problemi degli altri, vogliono amare se stessi, e quando gli viene data la buona sorte, dicono che è stato per via della propria abilità piuttosto che per semplice fortuna."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...Hmph... Gli umani sono creature infime... Quando si abbandonano al giudizio divino e ricevono una dose di buona sorte, vogliono avere la presunzione di dire che è stato frutto delle loro capacità, piuttosto che pura fortuna."
Turkish (TR): "...Hmph. .........İnsanlar basit varlıklardır. ......Ellerinden gelenin en iyisini yaptıklarını ve gerisini Tanrı'ya bıraktıklarını öne sürerler, ancak başlarına iyi bir talih geldiğinde, bunun basit bir şanstan değil, kendi başarılarından kaynaklandığını iddia edip kendilerini överler."

Steam (ST): That was why he wanted to check whether there was a wretched mark on the door. ...The very desire was human.
Umineko Project (UP): So he wanted to check whether there was a wretched mark on the door.{n}...That is only human.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So he wanted to check whether there was a wretched mark on the door. ...That's what humans would do.
PC Japanese (JP): だから、扉に惨めな痕跡があることを確かめたい。…それが人間というものだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): だから、扉に惨めな痕跡があることを確かめたい。{n}…それが人間というものだ。
Russian (RU): Да, ему хотелось удостовериться, был ли на двери тот ужасный знак.{n}...Так поступили бы люди.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso, ele queria checar se havia alguma miserável marca na porta.{n}...Isto são os humanos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，他才會想去確認門上有沒有一塌糊塗的痕跡。{n}…這就是人類。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，他才会想去确认门上有没有一塌糊涂的痕迹。{n}…这就是人类。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quindi volle controllare se ci fosse un nefasto marchio sulla porta. ... È ciò che gli umani farebbero.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Per questo voleva controllare se sulla porta ci fosse un marchio nefasto...{n}Era ciò che avrebbe fatto qualsiasi umano.
Turkish (TR): Bu nedenle kapının üzerinde kötü bir iz olup olmadığını kontrol etmek istedi.{n}...İnsani bir arzu.

Steam (ST): And that was why Kinzo did not check. He often rejected desires that came to him because he was human. By doing that, he could be immersed in a feeling of sufficiency, as though he himself had become a being that surpassed humans...
Umineko Project (UP): Therefore, Kinzo did not check. He repressed the things that he wanted to do because he was human. By that, Kinzo could immerse himself in a feeling of sufficiency, as though he had become a being that surpassed humans...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Therefore, Kinzo did not check. He repressed things that he wanted to do because he was human. By that, Kinzo could be immersed in a feeling of sufficiency, as though he himself had become a being that surpassed humans...
PC Japanese (JP): だから、金蔵は確かめない。人間だからしたくなることを、抑え付ける。それによって金蔵は、自分は人間を超えた存在に至ったのだという充足感に浸れるのだ…。
Russian (RU): Поэтому Кинзо не стал проверять. Он подавлял желания, порождаемые его человеческим существом. При этом Кинзо мог быть погружён в чувство самодостаточности, как если бы он стал сущностью, превосходящей людей...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E por isso Kinzo não verificou. Ele reprimia as coisas que ele queria fazer porque era humano. Por isso, Kinzo conseguia se imergir em um sentimento de suficiência, como se ele tivesse se tornado um ser que ultrapassou os humanos...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 也正因如此，金藏才沒去確認。控制住了是人類才有的慾望。金藏由此沉醉進了一種，自己達到了超脫於人類境界的充足感之中…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 也正因如此，金藏才没去确认。控制住了是人类才有的欲望。金藏由此沉醉进了一种，自己达到了超脱于人类境界的充足感之中…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Perciò, Kinzo non lo fece. Rifiutava le cose che, essendo umano, voleva fare. {n}Con questo, Kinzo poteva immergersi in un sentimento di sufficienza, come se fosse diventato un essere che sorpassava gli umani...
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): E pertanto, Kinzo non lo fece. Represse gli impulsi dovuti alla sua umanità. Così facendo, Kinzo poté crogiolarsi nella soddisfazione di aver raggiunto uno stadio superiore a quello umano...
Turkish (TR): Dolayısıyla, Kinzo kontrol etmedi. İnsan olduğu için yapmak istediği şeyleri bastırdı. Bu sayede Kinzo, sanki insanların ötesinde bir varlık haline gelmiş gibi bir yeterlilik hissine kendini kaptırabiliyordu...

Steam (ST): He recognized human desires for what they were...and guarded against them. Things that a human would want to do, he resisted.
Umineko Project (UP): He became aware of human desire, and forbade it.{n}Things that a human wanted to do, he resisted.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): He became aware of human desire, and forbade it. Things that a human wanted to do, he resisted.
PC Japanese (JP): 人の欲を自覚し、戒める。人のしたいことに、抗う。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 人の欲を自覚し、戒める。{n}人のしたいことに、抗う。
Russian (RU): Он заметил человеческое желание и подавил его.{n}Он сопротивлялся вещам, которые ему хотелось как человеку.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ele se tornou ciente do desejo humano, e o proibiu.{n}Ele resistia às coisas que um humano gostaria de fazer.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 人的欲求，他自覺自戒。{n}人的慾望，他抵抗拒絕。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 人的欲求，他自觉自戒。{n}人的欲望，他抵抗拒绝。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Divenne cosciente dei desideri umani, e li scacciò. Resistette, a cose che un umano voleva fare.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Aveva acquisito consapevolezza sui suoi desideri umani... e li aveva messi a freno.{n}Aveva resistito alle pulsioni dell'uomo...
Turkish (TR): İnsani arzularının farkına vardı ve onları engelledi.{n}Bir insanın yapmak istediği şeylere direniyordu.

Steam (ST): ...This eccentricity and rebellious nature had surely given him a rare genius, making it possible for him to succeed in his exploits as he revived the Ushiromiya family in a single generation...
Umineko Project (UP): ......This eccentric and rebellious sense had surely given him a rare genius, which must have allowed him to succeed in his exploits as he revived the Ushiromiya family in one generation...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......This eccentricity and rebellious sense had surely given him a rare genius, which must have allowed him to succeed in his exploits as he revived the Ushiromiya family in one generation...
PC Japanese (JP): ……この偏屈かつ捻くれたセンスが、きっと彼に稀な博才を与え、右代宮家を一代にして復興させるという偉業を成し遂げさせたに違いない…。
Russian (RU): ......Эта эксцентричность и мятежный разум наделили его редкостным гением, который возможно, позволил ему преуспеть в своих деяниях, когда ему удалось возродить семью Уширомия за одно поколение...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Este sentido excêntrico e rebelde certamente havia dado a ele um gênio muito raro, o qual deve ter permitido a ele suceder em suas façanhas enquanto revivia a família Ushiromiya em uma única geração...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……這既頑固又乖僻的品性，一定賜給了他少有的博才，讓他僅憑一代就完成了復興右代宮家的偉業…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……这既顽固又乖僻的品性，一定赐给了他少有的博才，让他仅凭一代就完成了复兴右代宫家的伟业…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Questo senso di eccentricità e di ribellione gli aveva di sicuro donato un genio raro, che gli deve aver permesso di portare a compimento i suoi atti facendo rivivere la famiglia Ushiromiya in una generazione...
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Quel suo senso di eccentricità scellerata gli aveva senz'altro donato un talento singolare per l'azzardo, che gli aveva indubbiamente permesso di compiere la grande impresa di risollevare la famiglia Ushiromiya in una generazione...
Turkish (TR): ......Bu egzantrik ve isyankâr his ona kesinlikle eşsiz bir zekâ kazandırmıştı, ve bu da Ushiromiya ailesini tek kuşak içinde yeniden canlandırırken başarıya ulaşmasını sağlamış olmalıydı...

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Steam (ST): "Well then, {f:5:Beatrice}. What were the six pieces you took? ...And, what will your next move be? ...Entertain me. ......My defense is perfect. I will not shame myself like last time. ...Heh, ...heheheh."
Umineko Project (UP): "Well then, {f:5:Beatrice}. What were the six pieces you took? ......And what will your next move be? ...Entertain me. .........My defense is perfect. I will not shame myself like last time. ......Heh, ......heheheh."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Well then, Beatrice. What were the six pieces you took? ......And, what will your next move be? ...Entertain me. .........My defense is perfect. I will not shame myself like last time. ......Heh, ......heheheh."
PC Japanese (JP): 「さて、ベアトリーチェ。お前が取った６つの駒は何なのか。……そして、次なる手はどうくるのか。…楽しませてもらうぞ。………私の守りは完璧だ。前回のような無様は晒さぬぞ。……ふ、……っふっふっふっふ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「さて、ベアトリーチェ。お前が取った６つの駒は何なのか。……そして、次なる手はどうくるのか。…楽しませてもらうぞ。………私の守りは完璧だ。前回のような無様は晒さぬぞ。……ふ、……っふっふっふっふ」
Russian (RU): "Ну что же, {f:5:Беатриче}. Кто эти шесть фигур, что ты собрала? ......И каким окажется твой следующий ход? ...Развлеки меня. .........Моя защита совершенна. Я не опозорюсь, как в прошлый раз. ......Хе... хе‐хе‐хе‐хе."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Pois bem, {f:5:Beatrice}. Quais foram as seis peças que você tomou? ......E qual será seu próximo movimento? ...Entretenha‐me. .........Minha defesa é perfeita. Não vou me envergonhar como da última vez. ......Heh, ......heheheh."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「好了，貝阿朵莉切。你吃掉的是哪六個棋子呢？……還有，下一手你又會怎麼殺來呢？…就讓我好好欣賞一下吧。………我的防御是完美的。不會再像上次那樣出醜了。……哼，……哼哼哼哼。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「好了，贝阿朵莉切。你吃掉的是哪六个棋子呢？……还有，下一手你又会怎么杀来呢？…就让我好好欣赏一下吧。………我的防御是完美的。不会再像上次那样出丑了。……哼，……哼哼哼哼。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Bene, Beatrice. Quali sono le sei pedine che hai preso? ... E, quale sarà la tua prossima mossa? ... Intrattienimi. ... La mia difesa è perfetta. Non mi umilierò come l'ultima volta. ... Heh... heheheh."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Bene, {f:5:Beatrice}. Quali sono le sei pedine che hai mangiato? E quale sarà la tua prossima mossa...? Su, intrattienimi... La mia difesa è impeccabile. Non mi esporrò alle stesse umiliazioni della volta scorsa... Eh... eheheheh."
Turkish (TR): "Pekâlâ, {f:5:Beatrice}. Aldığın altı taş hangileriydi? ......Ve bir sonraki hamlen ne olacak? ...Beni eğlendir. .........Defansım mükemmel. Geçen seferki gibi kendimi utandırmayacağım. ......Heh, ......heheheh."

Steam (ST): The servants woke early. They had to open the curtains, prepare breakfast, and complete various other tasks to welcome the guests to a new day.
Umineko Project (UP): The servants woke early. They had to open the curtains, prepare breakfast, and complete various other tasks to welcome the guests to a new day.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 使用人たちの朝は早い。カーテンを開け、朝食の準備をし、新しい一日で客人たちを迎えるための様々な準備をしなくてはならない。
Russian (RU): Прислуга просыпалась рано. В их обязанности входило открыть шторы, приготовить завтрак и успеть выполнить ряд других задач, поприветствовав гостей с новым днём.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Os serviçais acordavam cedo. Eles tinham que abrir as cortinas, preparar o café da manhã e completar várias outras tarefas para saudar os hóspedes a um novo dia.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 傭人們的清晨來得很早。他們必須拉開窗簾，準備早餐，為了讓客人們迎來全新的一天，而做各種各樣的準備工作。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 佣人们的清晨来得很早。他们必须拉开窗帘，准备早餐，为了让客人们迎来全新的一天，而做各种各样的准备工作。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): I domestici si svegliarono presto. Dovevano aprire le tende, preparare la colazione e portare a termine diversi altri compiti per dare agli ospiti il benvenuto ad un nuovo giorno.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): I domestici si svegliarono presto. Dovevano aprire le tende, allestire la colazione, e svolgere diversi altri preparativi per accogliere gli ospiti all'inizio di una nuova giornata.
Turkish (TR): Hizmetkârlar erkenden uyandı. Perdeleri açmaları, kahvaltıyı hazırlamaları ve misafirleri yeni bir güne karşılamak için çeşitli diğer işleri tamamlamaları gerekiyordu.

Steam (ST): Gohda was the most enthusiastic.
Umineko Project (UP): Gohda was the most enthusiastic.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Gohda was the most enthusiastic.
PC Japanese (JP): 一番、大張り切りなのは郷田だった。
Russian (RU): Больше всех энтузиазма проявлял Года.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Gohda era o mais entusiasmado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 幹得最起勁的人是鄉田。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 干得最起劲的人是乡田。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Gohda era il più entusiasta.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Gouda era quello con più entusiasmo di tutti.
Turkish (TR): En hevesli olan Gohda'ydı.

Steam (ST): During the family conference, he had been told to concentrate his efforts especially on cooking, and he'd been specially exempted from several tasks that servants normally must do.
Umineko Project (UP): He had been told to concentrate his efforts in particular on his work as a chef for the duration of the family conference, and he had been specially exempted from several tasks that servants normally must do.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): During the family conference, he had been told to especially concentrate his efforts on cooking, and he had been specially exempted from several tasks that servants normally must do.
PC Japanese (JP): 親族会議の期間中は、特に料理人としての仕事に集中するように言われており、本来、使用人がこなさなければならないいくつかの仕事が特別に免除されていた。
Russian (RU): Во время собрания семьи ему было приказано сосредоточить все свои силы на приготовлении еды, и он был специально освобождён от ряда задач, обычно лежавших на прислуге.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Foi dito a ele para focar seus esforços apenas à cozinha durante o período da conferência familiar, e ele havia sido especialmente isentado de diversas tarefas que os serviçais normalmente devem fazer.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 他被吩咐過，在親族會議這段時間裡，要專心去做廚師的工作，還被特別免除了好幾項傭人原本必須要做的工作。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 他被吩咐过，在亲族会议这段时间里，要专心去做厨师的工作，还被特别免除了好几项佣人原本必须要做的工作。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Durante la riunione di famiglia, gli è stato ordinato di concentrare i suoi sforzi specialmente sulla cucina, ed è stato dispensato da altri compiti che normalmente i domestici devono fare.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Durante la riunione di famiglia gli era stato detto di focalizzare i suoi sforzi nel suo campo da chef, ed aveva ricevuto un esonero speciale dagli incarichi normalmente di competenza ai domestici...
Turkish (TR): Kendisine, aile konferansı süresince çabalarını özellikle aşçılık işine yoğunlaştırması söylenmiş, ve hizmetkârların normal şartlarda yapması gereken bazı görevlerden özel olarak muaf tutulmuştu.

Steam (ST): ...Gohda, who was a show off, seemed to be feeling particularly superior because of that. He let Genji and the rest prepare the rest of the mansion...and worked on making breakfast in the kitchen.
Umineko Project (UP): ...It seemed that Gohda, who was a show off, had a particular feeling of supremacy about that. He left the preparations of the inside of the mansion to Genji and the rest, and worked on preparing breakfast in the kitchen.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …見栄っ張りな郷田は、その辺りに優越感を特に感じるらしい。館内の準備を源次たちに任せ、厨房で朝食の準備に勤しむのだった。
Russian (RU): ...Было видно, что Года, любивший выделяться, ощущал от этого некоторое собственное превосходство. Он оставил приготовления внутри особняка на Генджи и остальных и занялся приготовлением завтрака на кухне.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Parecia que Gohda, que era exibido, tinha um sentimento particular de supremacia sobre aquilo. Ele deixou as preparações do interior da mansão para Genji e os outros serviçais, e trabalhou preparando o café da manhã na cozinha.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …要面子的鄉田，似乎在這點上感到了非同尋常的優越感。他把大屋內的準備工作交給了源次他們，自己在廚房賣力地準備早餐。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …要面子的乡田，似乎在这点上感到了非同寻常的优越感。他把大屋内的准备工作交给了源次他们，自己在厨房卖力地准备早餐。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Sembrava che Gohda, che ostentava la sua bravura, avesse un particolare sentimento di supremazia riguardo ciò. Lasciò la preparazione dell'interno della residenza a Genji e gli altri, e preparò la colazione in cucina.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Sembrava che Gouda, da esibizionista qual era, avesse un gran complesso di superiorità a riguardo. Lasciò a Genji e gli altri l'allestimento dell'interno della residenza, mentre lui si mise a lavorare in cucina per preparare la colazione.
Turkish (TR): ...Gösteriş meraklısı olan Gohda'nın bu konuda özel bir üstünlük duygusuna sahip olduğu anlaşılıyordu. Malikanenin iç hazırlıklarını Genji ve diğerlerine bırakarak mutfakta kahvaltıyı hazırlamaya koyuldu.

Steam (ST): Genji split the work with Shannon and Kanon, and they carried out various tasks.
Umineko Project (UP): Genji split the work with Shannon and Kanon, and they carried out various tasks.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Genji split the work with Shannon and Kanon, and they carried out various tasks.
PC Japanese (JP): 源次は、紗音と嘉音の三人で手分けして、様々な準備をこなしていく。
Russian (RU): Генджи разделил работу между Шаннон и Канон, и они занялись выполнением разных задач.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Genji dividiu o trabalho com Shannon e Kanon, e eles executaram várias tarefas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 源次與紗音和嘉音三人，分頭做著各種各樣的準備工作。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 源次与纱音和嘉音三人，分头做着各种各样的准备工作。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Genji divise il lavoro con Shannon e Kanon, e completarono diverse faccende.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Genji divise i compiti tra lui, Shannon e Kanon, e i tre eseguirono diverse faccende.
Turkish (TR): Genji, işleri Shannon ve Kanon ile paylaştı ve çeşitli görevleri yerine getirdiler.

Steam (ST): Shannon headed to the dining hall and knocked.
Umineko Project (UP): Shannon headed to the dining hall and knocked.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Shannon headed to the dining hall and knocked.
PC Japanese (JP): 紗音は、食堂へ向かい、ノックした。
Russian (RU): Шаннон направилась в обеденный зал и постучала.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Shannon seguiu para a sala de jantar e bateu na porta.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 紗音來到餐廳，敲了敲門。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 纱音来到餐厅，敲了敲门。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Shannon si diresse alla sala da cena, e bussò.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Shannon si diresse alla sala da pranzo, per poi bussare...
Turkish (TR): Shannon yemek salonuna yöneldi ve kapıyı çaldı.

Steam (ST): ...Last year, the family conference had continued into the early hours of the morning. It wouldn't have been odd if this year's conference had done the same.
Umineko Project (UP): ...Last year, the family conference had continued into the small hours of the night. It wouldn't have been odd for this year's conference to continue all the way into the next morning.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Last year, the family conference had continued into the early hours of the morning. It wouldn't have been odd for this year's conference to continue until the early morning.
PC Japanese (JP): …昨年は、親族会議は未明にまで及んだ。今年の親族会議は、とうとう早朝にまで及んでも不思議はない。
Russian (RU): ...В прошлом году семейное собрание продолжалось до раннего утра. Не было ничего удивительного, если в этом году собрание вновь затянулось до самого утра.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...No ano passado, a conferência familiar tinha continuado madrugada adentro. Não teria sido estranho para a conferência deste ano continuar até a manhã seguinte.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …去年，親族會議一直開到了凌晨。那麼今年的親族會議，就算延長到了早上也沒什麼好奇怪的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …去年，亲族会议一直开到了凌晨。那么今年的亲族会议，就算延长到了早上也没什么好奇怪的。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Lo scorso anno, la riunione di famiglia continuò fino alle prime ore del mattino. Non sarebbe stato strano se la riunione di quest'anno sarebbe continuata fino all'alba.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Nell'anno precedente, la riunione di famiglia proseguì fino all'alba. Non sarebbe stata una strana occorrenza se la riunione di quest'anno si fosse protratta fino alle prime ore del mattino.
Turkish (TR): ...Geçen yıl aile toplantısı gecenin ilerleyen saatlerine kadar devam etmişti. Bu yılki konferansın da ertesi sabaha kadar sürmesi hiç de garip olmazdı.

Steam (ST): Considering the possibility that they were still having a discussion inside, she knocked.
Umineko Project (UP): So she had knocked out of consideration for the possibility that they were still having a discussion inside.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Considering the possibility that they were still having a discussion inside, she knocked.
PC Japanese (JP): まだ中で会議が続いている可能性を考え、ノックしたのだった。
Russian (RU): Учитывая вероятность того, что они по‐прежнему заняты обсуждением внутри, она постучала.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso ela havia batido na porta em consideração pela possibilidade de ainda estarem tendo uma discussão dentro da sala.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 紗音是想著裡面可能還在開會，而敲的門。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Tenendo in conto la possibilità che la riunione fosse ancora in corso, bussò.

Steam (ST): But there was no response, so she opened the door and said good morning.
Umineko Project (UP): But there was no response, so she opened the door and said good morning.

Umineko Project (UP): The room was cold, and it seemed that the conference had ended a long time before.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): L'aria della stanza era gelida, e pareva che la riunione si fosse conclusa da molto tempo.

Steam (ST): There was a tea set on the table from which they'd probably been drinking, arranged in a way that would make it easy to clean up.
Umineko Project (UP): On top of the table, there was a tea set, from which they had probably been drinking, arranged in a way that would make it easy to clean them up.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): On top of the table, there was a tea set, from which they had probably been drinking, arranged in a way that would make it easy to clean them up.
PC Japanese (JP): 机の上には、彼らが飲んだのだろう、お茶の道具が集められ、片付けやすいようになっていた。
Russian (RU): Кроме того, на столе стоял чайный сервиз, из которого они, возможно, пили, размещенный таким образом, что его легко было собрать.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Em cima da mesa, havia um jogo de chá, do qual eles provavelmente tinham bebido, arranjado de uma forma que deixaria fácil limpá‐lo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 他們大概是喝過了茶，桌子上用過的茶具擺在了一起，挺方便收拾的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 他们大概是喝过了茶，桌子上用过的茶具摆在了一起，挺方便收拾的。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Sul tavolo, c'era un set da tè, dal quale stavano probabilmente bevendo, disposto in modo da pulirlo facilmente.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Sul tavolo vi era un set da tè da cui probabilmente avevano bevuto, disposto in modo da poter essere facilmente portato via.
Turkish (TR): Masanın üstünde, muhtemelen çay içmek için kullandıkları bir çay seti vardı ve kolayca toparlanabilecek şekilde dizilmişti.

Steam (ST): Cleaning up the tea was a servant's job. If the family members were extra generous and cleaned it up themselves, the servants would lose face.
Umineko Project (UP): Cleaning away the tea was a servant's job. So if the family was too caring and cleaned it up themselves, the servants would lose face.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Cleaning up the tea was a servant's job. So if the family was too caring and cleaned it up themselves, the servants would lose face.
PC Japanese (JP): お茶の片付けは使用人の仕事だ。だから、彼らが気を利かせ過ぎて片付けてしまうと、使用人の立つ瀬がなくなる。
Russian (RU): Убирать чайный сервиз входило в обязанности прислуги. Так что если бы семья сама позаботилась убрать его, то прислуга потеряла бы лицо.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Limpar o chá era o trabalho de um serviçal. Por isso, se a família fosse atenciosa demais e limpassem‐no por conta própria, os serviçais ficariam em uma situação embaraçosa, sem saber como reagir.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 收拾喝完的茶是傭人的工作。所以，他們要是過於客氣地收拾好了這些，傭人便會顏面盡失。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 收拾喝完的茶是佣人的工作。所以，他们要是过于客气地收拾好了这些，佣人便会颜面尽失。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Pulire le tazze da tè è il lavoro di un domestico. Quindi, se la famiglia fosse troppo premurosa e l'avessero pulita loro, i domestici avrebbero perso la faccia.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Riporre via le tazze da tè è compito di un domestico. Pertanto, essere troppo premurosi e sistemarle al posto dei domestici intaccherebbe la loro reputazione.
Turkish (TR): Çayları toplamak bir hizmetkârın işiydi. Eğer aile çok ilgili davranır ve kendileri temizlerse, hizmetkârlar itibar kaybederdi.

Steam (ST): So, it was a truly pleasant act of kindness for the family to do only this much.
Umineko Project (UP): Therefore, just doing this much for the servants truly was a pleasing act of kindness.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Therefore, just doing this much for the servants truly was a pleasing act of kindness.
PC Japanese (JP): だから、こうしてもらえるだけでも本当に嬉しい気遣いだった。
Russian (RU): Поэтому расставить сервиз для прислуги удобным образом действительно было приятным проявлением доброты.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Logo, deixar desse jeito era, na verdade, um ato de gentileza para com os serviçais.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 因此，僅僅是擺成這樣，就已是讓傭人倍感欣慰的貼心之舉了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 因此，仅仅是摆成这样，就已是让佣人倍感欣慰的贴心之举了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quindi, fare semplicemente ciò per i domestici è veramente un atto di gentilezza.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Di conseguenza, limitarsi a questi gesti era un grande atto di gentilezza nei loro confronti.
Turkish (TR): Bu nedenle, hizmetkârlar için bu kadarını yapmak bile gerçekten hoş bir nezaket göstergesiydi.

Steam (ST): As she approached the table to clean it, she noticed something like a memo that had been left near the utensils and cups.
Umineko Project (UP): As she approached the table to clean it away, she noticed that something like a memo had been left along with the cups.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As she approached the table to clean it, she noticed something like a memo that had been left with the utensils.
PC Japanese (JP): 片付けようとテーブルに近付くと、メモ用紙のようなものが食器と一緒に残されているのに気が付いた。
Russian (RU): Как только она подошла к столу, чтобы убрать его, она заметила нечто вроде записки, лежавшей рядом с посудой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Enquanto ela se aproximava da mesa para limpá‐lo, notou que algo semelhante a um bilhete havia sido deixado junto com as xícaras.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 紗音走近桌子想去收拾時，發現了一張像是便條一樣的紙張，與茶具一同留在了桌上。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 纱音走近桌子想去收拾时，发现了一张像是便条一样的纸张，与茶具一同留在了桌上。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Avvicinandosi al tavolo per ripulirlo, notò che, accanto agli utensili da cucina, era stato lasciato una sorta di appunto.
Turkish (TR): Masayı temizlemek için yaklaştığında, fincanların yanına not gibi bir şey bırakıldığını fark etti.

Steam (ST): Since it was right next to the tea set, Shannon picked it up, naturally thinking it was a memo for the servant doing the cleaning.
Umineko Project (UP): It had been placed together with the tea set, so, naturally thinking it was a memo for the servant cleaning up, Shannon took it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It had been placed together with the tea set, so naturally thinking it was a memo for the servant cleaning up, Shannon took it.
PC Japanese (JP): お茶の道具と一緒に置かれていたので、片付けに来た使用人に対し申し送ったメモだろうと自然に思い、紗音はそれを手に取る。
Russian (RU): Она лежала вместе с чайным сервизом, поэтому естественно полагая, что это записка для убирающей прислуги, Шаннон взяла её.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ele havia sido colocado junto com o jogo de chá, então, naturalmente, pensando que fosse um bilhete direcionado ao serviçal responsável pela limpeza, Shannon o pegou.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 由於這便條是和茶具擺在一起的，於是紗音自然而然地想到，這應該是留給來收拾的傭人的便條，將它拿了起來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 由于这便条是和茶具摆在一起的，于是纱音自然而然地想到，这应该是留给来收拾的佣人的便条，将它拿了起来。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): È stato piazzato insieme al set da tè, quindi, pensando naturalmente che fosse un promemoria per il domestico che doveva pulire, Shannon lo prese.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Dato che era stato posto insieme al set da tè, Shannon lo prese, venendole spontaneo pensare che fosse un promemoria stilato per il domestico che sarebbe venuto a mettere ordine.
Turkish (TR): Çay takımının yanına konmuştu, bu yüzden doğal olarak ortalığı temizleyen bir hizmetkârın notu olduğunu düşünen Shannon onu aldı.

Steam (ST): Written there was not a request, nor was it thanks for preparing the tea. There was just a single word.
Umineko Project (UP): Written on it was not a request, nor thanks for preparing the tea, but just a single word.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Written on it was not a request, nor was it thanks for preparing the tea. There was just a single word.
PC Japanese (JP): そこには、要望でもなく、お茶の準備に対する感謝でもなく、ただ一言だけが書かれていた。
Russian (RU): В ней была написана ни просьба, ни благодарность за приготовленный чай. Лишь одно слово.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Escrito nele não estava um pedido, nem um agradecimento por preparar o chá, mas apenas uma única palavra.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 这上面，没有写命令，也没有写对备茶的感谢，只写了一句话。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Su di esso non vi era trascritta una richiesta, né un ringraziamento per i preparativi del te, ma una singola parola.
Turkish (TR): Üzerinde ne bir talep ne de çayı hazırladıkları için bir teşekkür yazılıydı, sadece tek bir kelime vardı.

Steam (ST): Shannon looked at it blankly and read it out loud...
Umineko Project (UP): Shannon looked at it blankly, and read it out loud...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Shannon looked at it blankly, and read it out loud...

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Shannon olhou sem demonstrar qualquer expressão, e a leu em voz alta...

Chinese Simplified (CN): 纱音愣了一下，将它念了出来…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Shannon la guardò con aria assente, e la lesse ad alta voce...
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Shannon la guardò con esitazione, e la lesse ad alta voce...
Turkish (TR): Shannon boş boş baktı ve yüksek sesle okudu...

Speaker: Shannon
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Cappella. ...?"
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...Cappella...?"

Steam (ST): A small sound kept repeating over and over. Normally, that sound would've been too trivial to be worth caring about.
Umineko Project (UP): A small sound kept repeating over and over.{n}It was a sound that would ordinarily have been trivial and insignificant.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): A small sound kept repeating over and over. It was a sound that was normally worthless and boring.

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 何か小さな音がずっと聞こえ続けていた。{n}それは本来ならば取るに足らないつまらない音。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Um som baixo continuou se repetindo de novo e de novo.{n}Era um som que ordinariamente teria sido trivial e insignificante.

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Un rumore sommesso continuava a ripetersi senza sosta.{n}Era un suono che, normalmente, sarebbe stato privo di ogni qualsivoglia importanza.
Turkish (TR): Hafif bir ses sürekli olarak tekrar ediyordu.{n}Normalde önemsiz ve anlamsız olabilecek bir sesti.

Steam (ST): If only I could stop hearing it soon, I could go back to sleep right away, ...she thought vaguely.
Umineko Project (UP): I hope I stop hearing it soon, then I could return to my doze, someone thought vaguely.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If only I could stop hearing it soon, then I could quickly return to my doze, someone thought vaguely.
PC Japanese (JP): 早く聞こえなくなればいい、そうすればまどろみに戻れるのにと、ぼんやり考えていた。
Russian (RU): Если бы я только как можно скорее могла перестать слышать, тогда смогла бы быстро вернуться к своему сну. Таковы были смутные мысли кого‐то.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Espero parar de ouvi‐lo em breve, então eu poderei retornar à minha soneca, alguém pensou vagamente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 若是響聲能快些停止就好了，這樣就能再打會盹兒了，我迷迷糊糊地想著。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 若是响声能快些停止就好了，这样就能再打会盹儿了，我迷迷糊糊地想着。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Qualcuno pensò vagamente, se solo potessi smettere di sentirlo presto, allora potrei tornare a sonnecchiare.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): ‘Se ci vorrà poco per non sentirlo più, potrei tornare a sonnecchiare...’, pensò in maniera confusa...
Turkish (TR): Keşke bir an önce kesilse de, uykuma dönebilsem, ...diye aklından geçirdi.

Steam (ST): ...But no matter how much time passed, the sound did not end. It repeated over and over.
Umineko Project (UP): ...But no matter how much time passed, the sound did not end.{n}It repeated over and over.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...But no matter how much time passed, the sound did not end. It repeated over and over.
PC Japanese (JP): …しかしいつまでも音は終わらない。ずっとずっと繰り返されている。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …しかしいつまでも音は終わらない。{n}ずっとずっと繰り返されている。
Russian (RU): ...Но независимо от того, сколько прошло времени, звук всё не прекращался.{n}Он повторялся снова и снова.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Mas não importa quanto tempo se passasse, o som não parou.{n}Ele continuou a se repetir incessantemente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …可是不管等多久它都不停。{n}一直一直反反覆覆地響著。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …可是不管等多久它都不停。{n}一直一直反反复复地响着。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Ma non importa quanto tempo fosse passato, il suono non smetteva. {n}Si ripeteva ancora e ancora.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Tuttavia, il rumore era incessante.{n}Si ripeteva ancora e ancora.
Turkish (TR): ...Ama ne kadar zaman geçerse geçsin, ses kesilmiyordu.{n}Defalarca tekrarladı.

Steam (ST): Aaah, shut up. Who is it? Banging on the door this whole time...
Umineko Project (UP): Aaah, shut up.{n}Who is that? Banging on the door constantly.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Aaah, shut up. Who is it? Banging on the door the whole time.

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): あぁ、うるさい。{n}誰なの？　扉をずっと叩き続けているのは。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Aaah, cale‐se.{n}Quem é? Batendo na porta esse tempo todo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 啊，好吵。{n}是誰啊？是誰一直在敲著門？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 啊，好吵。{n}是谁啊？是谁一直在敲着门？
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Aaah, sta' zitto. Chi è? Quello che sbatte sempre sulla porta.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): ‘Aaah, che fastidio. Chi è? Chi è che continua a bussare costantemente sulla porta...?’.
Turkish (TR): Aaah, kapa çeneni.{n}Kim o? Bunca zamandır kapıya vuruluyordu.

Steam (ST): As soon as she realized that, she woke up. ...Someone was knocking.
Umineko Project (UP): As soon as she realized this, she woke up.{n}......Someone was knocking.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As soon as she noticed that, she woke up.......Someone was knocking.

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): それに気付いた途端、目が覚めた。{n}……誰かがノックしているのだ。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Assim que percebeu, ela acordou.{n}......Alguém estava batendo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 剛意識到這一點，我就醒了過來。{n}……有人在敲門。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 刚意识到这一点，我就醒了过来。{n}……有人在敲门。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Non appena lo notò, si svegliò. ... Qualcuno stava bussando.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Nel momento in cui se ne accorse, i suoi occhi si aprirono...{n}Qualcuno stava bussando.
Turkish (TR): Bunu fark ettiği anda, uyandı.{n}......Birisi kapıyı çalıyordu.

Steam (ST): Then, she noticed that it wasn't just a knock, but a voice as well.
Umineko Project (UP): Then she noticed that there wasn't just a knock, but a voice too.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then she noticed that there wasn't just a knock, but a voice.

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………楼座さま、…楼座さま。……おはようございます」

Steam (ST): It had been Genji's voice. Looking at the clock, it wasn't even 7:00 yet.
Umineko Project (UP): It had been Genji's voice.{n}Looking at the clock, it was still before seven.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It had been Genji's voice. Looking at the clock, it was still before 7:00.
PC Japanese (JP): それは源次の声だった。時計を見ると、まだ７時にもなっていない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): それは源次の声だった。{n}時計を見ると、まだ７時にもなっていない。
Russian (RU): Это был голос Генджи.{n}Взглянув на часы, было всего лишь семь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Era a voz de Genji.{n}Olhando o relógio, ainda não era sete horas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 那是源次的聲音。{n}看了下時鐘，連七點都沒到。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 那是源次的声音。{n}看了下时钟，连七点都没到。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Era la voce di Genji. Guardando l'ora, non erano neanche le 7:00.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Era la voce di Genji.{n}Guardando l'orologio, non erano ancora le sette...
Turkish (TR): Bu Genji'nin sesiydi.{n}Saate baktığında saat yedi bile değildi.

Steam (ST): ...It was clearly too early to wake the guests. ...Did something happen that was bad enough to cause this?
Umineko Project (UP): ......It was clearly too early to wake the guests.{n}...Did something happen that was bad enough to cause this?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......It was clearly too early to wake the guests. ...Did something happen that was bad enough to cause this?
PC Japanese (JP): ……客人を起こすには明らかに早すぎる時間だった。…それに値する何か良くないことでもあったのだろうか。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……客人を起こすには明らかに早すぎる時間だった。{n}…それに値する何か良くないことでもあったのだろうか。
Russian (RU): ......Ещё довольно рано, чтобы будить гостей.{n}...Что‐то случилось, что‐то очень плохое, раз их вызывают?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Claramente era cedo demais para acordar os hóspedes.{n}...Aconteceu algo ruim o suficiente para causar isto?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……來叫客人起床的話，這時間顯然是太早了。{n}…是發生了什麼不好的事，以至於源次都這麼早來喊人了嗎？
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……来叫客人起床的话，这时间显然是太早了。{n}…是发生了什么不好的事，以至于源次都这么早来喊人了吗？
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Era chiaramente troppo presto per svegliare gli ospiti. ... Era successo qualcosa di talmente eclatante da causare tutto ciò?
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Era chiaramente un orario troppo precoce per svegliare gli ospiti...{n}Cos'era successo di tanto grave da causare qualcosa del genere?
Turkish (TR): ......Misafirleri uyandırmak için fazla erken olduğu ortadaydı.{n}...Buna neden olacak kadar kötü bir şey mi olmuştu?

Steam (ST): She felt her sleepiness increasingly fade thanks to this premonition of misfortune.
Umineko Project (UP): She felt her sleepiness increasingly fade thanks to this ominous premonition.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She felt her sleepiness increasingly fade thanks to this premonition of misfortune.
PC Japanese (JP): その不吉な予感に、眠気がどんどん醒めてくるのを感じた。
Russian (RU): Она ощутила, как её сонливость словно рукой сняло это предчувствие беды.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela sentiu sua sonolência sumir gradativamente graças a essa premonição agourenta.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這份不吉的預感，將倦意紛紛趕走了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这份不吉的预感，将倦意纷纷赶走了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Lei sentì che la sua sonnolenza stava progressivamente svanendo a causa di questa premonizione di sventura.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): A causa di quel presagio sinistro, sentì che la sua sonnolenza stava andando progressivamente a svanire.
Turkish (TR): Bu uğursuz önsezi sayesinde uykulu halinin giderek kaybolduğunu hissetti.

Steam (ST): Though Genji was a servant, Rosa had known him since her childhood days, so even though she was slightly defenseless in her pajamas, she opened the door a crack and answered.
Umineko Project (UP): Because Genji had been a familiar servant to Rosa since her childhood days, she opened the door a crack and answered, even though she was slightly defenseless in her pajamas.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Because Genji had been a familiar servant to Rosa since her childhood days, even though she was slightly defenseless in her pajamas, she opened the door a crack and answered.
PC Japanese (JP): 楼座にとって、源次は子どもの頃から馴染みのある使用人であったため、少し無防備に寝巻き姿のまま、扉を細く開けて応じた。
Russian (RU): Поскольку Генджи как слуга был знаком Розе ещё с детства, даже несмотря на свою беззащитность в одной пижаме, она слегка приоткрыла дверь и ответила.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por Genji ter sido um serviçal familiar à Rosa desde seus dias de infância, ela abriu uma fresta da porta e respondeu, mesmo que estivesse ligeiramente indefesa em seu pijama.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 對樓座來說，源次是她從小就很熟悉的傭人，所以她沒什麼防備地穿著睡衣，輕輕把門打開了一條縫。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 对楼座来说，源次是她从小就很熟悉的佣人，所以她没什么防备地穿着睡衣，轻轻把门打开了一条缝。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Dato che Genji era stato un domestico familiare a Rosa sin dalla sua infanzia, nonostante lei fosse leggermente vulnerabile in pigiama, aprì di poco la porta e rispose.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Poiché Genji era un domestico che conosceva sin dall'infanzia, Rosa fu un po' meno allarmata di prima, e ancora in pigiama, aprì lievemente la porta.
Turkish (TR): Genji, Rosa'nın çocukluk günlerinden beri tanıdığı bir hizmetkâr olduğu için, pijamalarının içinde biraz güç durumda olmasına rağmen kapıyı hafifçe aralayıp cevap verdi.

Speaker: Ronoue Genji

Umineko Project (UP): "Good morning. I apologize for waking you this early."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「おはようございます。早朝から申し訳ございません」
Russian (RU): "Доброе утро. Я прошу прощения за то, что разбудил вас так рано."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Bom dia. Peço desculpas por acordá‐la tão cedo assim."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「早上好。一大早的，非常抱歉。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Buongiorno. Le mie sentite scuse per averla svegliata così presto di mattina."
Turkish (TR): "Günaydın. Sizi bu kadar erken uyandırdığım için özür dilerim."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……出什么事了吗？」

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...È successo qualcosa?"

Steam (ST): Genji...whispered something into Rosa's ear.
Umineko Project (UP): Genji spoke into Rosa's ear, and told her something in a small voice.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 源次は楼座の耳元に口を寄せ、小声で何かを伝えた。
Russian (RU): Генджи приблизился к уху Розы, и что‐то тихо сказал ей.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Genji falou no ouvido de Rosa, e disse algo a ela em uma voz baixa.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 源次把嘴靠近楼座耳边，小声告诉了她些什么。
