Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Genji avvicinò la bocca all'orecchio di Rosa, sussurrandole qualcosa a bassa voce.
Turkish (TR): Genji Rosa'nın kulağına doğru eğildi ve kısık bir sesle ona bir şeyler söyledi.

Steam (ST): For a second, it seemed Rosa couldn't understand what she'd been told. After having it repeated several times, she realized that apparently, something strange had happened.
Umineko Project (UP): It seemed that Rosa couldn't understand what she was being told after only hearing it once, and after repeating the words back to him several times, she finally realized that apparently, something strange had happened.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): For a second, it seemed that Rosa couldn't understand what she had been told, and after having it repeated several times, she realized that apparently, something strange had happened.
PC Japanese (JP): 楼座は、一度では何を言われているか理解できなかったらしく、何度か復唱してからようやく何かおかしなことが起きたらしいことを理解する。
Russian (RU): Поначалу Роза даже не поняла, что ей сказали. И после того как, ей повторили несколько раз, она осознала, что, судя по всему, случилось нечто странное.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Aparentemente Rosa não conseguiu entender o que lhe tinha sido dito depois de ouvir apenas uma vez, e depois de repetir as palavras de volta a ele diversas vezes, ela finalmente percebeu que aparentemente, algo estranho havia acontecido.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 樓座似乎只聽一遍沒能理解源次說的話，等源次複述了好幾遍之後，她才總算明白，好像是發生了什麼不對勁的事。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 楼座似乎只听一遍没能理解源次说的话，等源次复述了好几遍之后，她才总算明白，好像是发生了什么不对劲的事。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Per un secondo, sembrò che Rosa non avesse capito ciò che le era stato detto, e dopo che le fu ripetuto più volte, lei capì che apparentemente, qualcosa di strano era successo.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Per un attimo sembrava che Rosa non avesse compreso ciò che le era stato detto, e dopo che lo ripetè più volte per avere una conferma, capì alla fine che apparentemente era successo qualcosa di strano.
Turkish (TR): Rosa, söylenenleri ilk defa duyduğunda kendisine söylenenleri anlayamamış gibi görünüyordu, ve bu sözler birkaç kez tekrarladıktan sonra nihayet garip bir şeyler olduğunu fark etti.

Steam (ST): Rosa closed her door for a second, changed her clothes quickly, and followed Genji towards the mansion...
Umineko Project (UP): Rosa closed her door for a second, and after changing her clothes, she immediately accompanied Genji and they headed to the mansion...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Rosa closed her door for a second, and after changing her clothes, she immediately accompanied Genji and they headed to the mansion...
PC Japanese (JP): 楼座は一度扉を閉め、すぐに着替えると源次を伴い、屋敷へ向かうのだった…。
Russian (RU): Ненадолго закрыв дверь, Роза быстро переоделась, а затем немедленно присоединилась к Генджи, и они направились к особняку...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Rosa fechou sua porta por um segundo, e depois de mudar suas roupas, imediatamente acompanhou Genji e seguiram para a mansão...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 樓座關上門立刻換好衣服後，和源次一起向著大屋走去…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 楼座关上门立刻换好衣服后，和源次一起向着大屋走去…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Rosa chiuse la porta per un secondo, e dopo essersi cambiata, accompagnò immediatamente Genji dirigendosi verso la villa...
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Rosa chiuse momentaneamente la porta, si cambiò velocemente d'abito e seguì Genji, dirigendosi verso la villa...
Turkish (TR): Rosa bir an için kapısını kapattı ve kıyafetlerini değiştirdikten sonra hızla Genji'ye katıldıktan sonra birlikte malikaneye doğru yola koyuldular...

Steam (ST): The chapel requires some explanation. It wasn't in the mansion, but in a grove behind it, a short walk's distance away.
Umineko Project (UP): The chapel requires some explanation. It wasn't in the mansion, but in a grove behind the mansion, which could be reached after a short walk.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The chapel requires some explanation. It wasn't in the mansion, but in a grove behind the mansion, which could be reached after a short walk.
PC Japanese (JP): 礼拝堂について、説明がいる。これは屋敷の中にはなく、屋敷の裏からほんの少しだけ歩いた木立の中にあった。
Russian (RU): Стоит разъяснить про часовню. Она находилась не в особняке, а в роще позади особняка, куда можно было попасть после краткой прогулки.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A capela requer alguma explicação. Ela não ficava na mansão, mas em um bosque atrás da mansão, o qual podia ser alcançado depois de uma curta caminhada.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 關於禮拜堂，有必要先說明一下。禮拜堂並不位於大屋內，而是在大屋背面，坐落在需要稍微步行一會才能走到的樹叢之中。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 关于礼拜堂，有必要先说明一下。礼拜堂并不位于大屋内，而是在大屋背面，坐落在需要稍微步行一会才能走到的树丛之中。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): La cappella necessita di qualche spiegazione. Non era nella villa, ma in un boschetto dietro di essa, che poteva essere raggiunto dopo una breve camminata.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Per quanto riguarda la cappella, occorrono delle spiegazioni. Non si trovava all'interno della villa, ma in un boschetto al suo retro, ed era raggiungibile dopo una breve camminata.
Turkish (TR): Kilisenin biraz açıklanması gerekiyor. Kilise malikanede değil, malikanenin arkasında, kısa bir yürüyüşün ardından ulaşılabilen bir koruluktaydı.

Steam (ST): It had been built at the same time as the mansion, so though its walls had been repaired many times, making it look new from the outside, it was a very old building.
Umineko Project (UP): It had been built at the same time that the mansion had been constructed on Rokkenjima, so while its outside walls had been repaired many times, making it look new from the outside, it was a very old building.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It had been built at the same time that the mansion had been constructed on Rokkenjima, so while its outside walls had been repaired many times, making it look new from the outside, it was a very old building.
PC Japanese (JP): 六軒島に屋敷が建てられたのと同時に建立されたもので、何度か外壁の補修を行ない、外見だけは新しそうに見えながらも、かなり古い建物であった。
Russian (RU): Она была построена на Роккенджиме одновременно с особняком, поэтому, тогда как фасад не раз восстанавливался, снаружи она выглядела как новая, в действительности являясь очень старым зданием.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela havia sido construída ao mesmo tempo que a mansão em Rokkenjima, então enquanto suas paredes exteriores haviam sido reparadas muitas vezes, fazendo‐a parecer nova por fora, na verdade era um prédio muito antigo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 它和六軒島的大屋是同時建成的，因此儘管外壁補修過好幾次，光看外觀也挺像是新造的，但其實它是一幢非常老舊的建築物。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 它和六轩岛的大屋是同时建成的，因此尽管外壁补修过好几次，光看外观也挺像是新造的，但其实它是一幢非常老旧的建筑物。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Era stata costruita nello stesso periodo in cui era stata edificata la villa su Rokkenjima, perciò mentre le pareti esterne erano state riparate varie volte, facendola sembrare nuova dall'esterno, era una costruzione molto vecchia.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Era stata costruita nello stesso periodo in cui a Rokkenjima era stata edificata la villa, perciò, sebbene le numerose riparazioni effettuate alle pareti esterne la facessero sembrare da fuori una struttura recente, era un edificio alquanto vecchio.
Turkish (TR): Rokkenjima'daki malikane ile aynı zamanda inşa edilmişti, bu nedenle dış duvarları birçok kez onarılmış olsa da, dışarıdan yeni görünmesine rağmen çok eski bir binaydı.

Steam (ST): Rosa dashed through the rain along with Genji. Just like the previous night, the rain was falling in earnest.
Umineko Project (UP): Rosa and Genji dashed through the rain together.{n}Just like the previous night, the rain was falling in earnest.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Rosa dashed through the rain along with Genji. Just like the previous night, the rain was falling in earnest.
PC Japanese (JP): 楼座と源次が共に雨の中を駆けていく。雨は昨夜から変わらず本格的な降りのままだった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 楼座と源次が共に雨の中を駆けていく。{n}雨は昨夜から変わらず本格的な降りのままだった。
Russian (RU): Роза вместе с Генджи бежали под дождем.{n}Как и предыдущей ночью, дождь разыгрался не на шутку.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Rosa e Genji correram juntos debaixo de chuva.{n}Assim como na noite anterior, a chuva estava desabando.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 樓座和源次一同在雨中飛奔著。{n}雨和昨晚一樣，仍下得十分起勁。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 楼座和源次一同在雨中飞奔着。{n}雨和昨晚一样，仍下得十分起劲。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Rosa corse attraverso la pioggia insieme a Genji. Proprio come la notte precedente, stava piovendo incessantemente.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Rosa corse sotto la pioggia assieme a Genji.{n}Stava piovendo senza tregua, proprio come la sera precedente.
Turkish (TR): Rosa, Genji ile birlikte yağmurun altında hızla ilerledi.{n}Tıpkı önceki akşam olduğu gibi, yağmur tüm şiddetiyle devam ediyordu.

Steam (ST): Eventually, the chapel came into sight from beyond a thin grove...
Umineko Project (UP): Eventually, they began to see the chapel beyond a sparse grove...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Eventually, they began to see the chapel beyond a thin grove...
PC Japanese (JP): やがて、薄い木立の向こうに礼拝堂が見えてくる…。
Russian (RU): В конце концов, они наконец увидели часовню за тонкой рощей...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eventualmente, eles começaram a ver a capela, além de um arvoredo esparso...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不久，禮拜堂從稀疏樹叢的另一邊映入了眼簾…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不久，礼拜堂从稀疏树丛的另一边映入了眼帘…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Alla fine, iniziarono a scorgere la cappella dietro uno sparuto boschetto...
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Dopo un po' di tempo, al di là di una piccola macchia di alberi, fu possibile scorgere la cappella...
Turkish (TR): Sonunda, seyrek bir koruluğun ardındaki kiliseyi görmeye başladılar...

Steam (ST): Just looking at it from the outside, it seemed a place of dazzling beauty, where a pair of young lovers might want to get married.
Umineko Project (UP): If all she knew of it was its appearance from the outside, it might have felt like a place of dazzling beauty, where a pair of young lovers might want to hold a ceremony.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Because they could only see it from the outside, it felt like a place of dazzling beauty, where a pair of young lovers might want to hold a ceremony.
PC Japanese (JP): 外観を見るだけだったなら、若い恋人たちが挙式をしてみたくなるような、美しく清らかなものに感じられただろう。
Russian (RU): Поскольку они видели только фасад, часовня казалось удивительной красоты местом, где пара молодых влюбленных, возможно, захотела бы бракосочетаться.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se tudo que ela soubesse dela fosse sua aparência de fora, ela poderia ter parecido um lugar de beleza estonteante, onde um par de jovens amantes poderia querer sediar uma cerimônia.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 若是僅看外觀，多半是會使人感到能讓年輕戀人們想在此舉行婚禮的，美麗聖潔之氣吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 若是仅看外观，多半是会使人感到能让年轻恋人们想在此举行婚礼的，美丽圣洁之气吧。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Dato che la potevano vedere solo dall'esterno, sembrava un posto dall'accecante bellezza, dove un paio di giovani amanti vorrebbero tenere una cerimonia.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Ad un'occhiata esterna pareva un luogo di una bellezza così autentica, che una coppia di giovani innamorati avrebbe potuto tenere al suo interno una cerimonia di matrimonio.
Turkish (TR): Eğer Rosa'nın burayla ilgili bildiği tek şey dışarıdan görünüşü olsaydı, bir çift genç aşığın düğün yapmak isteyebileceği, göz kamaştırıcı güzellikte bir yer gibi görünebilirdi.

Steam (ST): However, Kinzo apparently viewed it as a very sacred place, so Rosa and her siblings had been given strict instructions not to approach it unnecessarily.
Umineko Project (UP): However, it seemed that in Kinzo's eyes, this was a very sacred place, and Rosa and her siblings had been harshly told not to approach it unnecessarily.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, it seemed that in Kinzo's eyes, this was a very sacred place, so Rosa and her siblings had been harshly told not to approach it unnecessarily.
PC Japanese (JP): だが、この礼拝堂は金蔵にとってとても神聖なものだったらしく、楼座たち兄弟はみだりに近付くなと厳しく言われてきた。
Russian (RU): Но похоже, что в глазах Кинзо это было очень сокровенное место, поэтому Розе с её братьями и сестрой было настрого запрещено приближаться к ней без особой надобности.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Porém, parecia que, aos olhos de Kinzo, este era um lugar muito sagrado, e Rosa e seus irmãos haviam rigorosamente recebido ordens para não se aproximarem dela desnecessariamente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過，這禮拜堂對金藏來說，似乎是個非常神聖的地方，他一直嚴厲警告樓座几兄妹不准擅自靠近。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过，这礼拜堂对金藏来说，似乎是个非常神圣的地方，他一直严厉警告楼座几兄妹不准擅自靠近。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Tuttavia, sembrava che agli occhi di Kinzo, questo fosse un posto molto sacro, quindi a Rosa e agli altri fratelli era stato severamente detto di non avvicinarvisi senza motivo.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Tuttavia, apparentemente Kinzo attribuiva alla cappella un'enorme sacralità, e Rosa e gli altri fratelli erano stati ammoniti di non avvicinarvisi senza permesso.
Turkish (TR): Ancak Kinzo'nun gözünde burası çok kutsal bir mekândı, ve Rosa ile kardeşlerine buraya gerekmedikçe yaklaşmamaları gerektiği katı bir şekilde söylenmişti.

Steam (ST): Even though they were all grown up now, approaching the chapel for any reason would still make them feel guilty... and also afraid, as if their Father might get angry and hit them in the face...
Umineko Project (UP): So even at this age, and no matter what the reason for it, she felt some guilt in approaching the chapel, and was gripped by the fear that this would surely make her father so angry he would slap her across the face...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So even though they had grown up, they would feel some guilt if they approached the chapel, no matter what the reason, and felt some fear, as though their Father would get angry and hit them in the face...
PC Japanese (JP): だから、この歳になり、どのような理由をつけたにしろ、礼拝堂に近付くことにある種の罪悪感と、父親に頬を打たれるほどに怒られるに違いないという恐怖感を感じるのだった…。
Russian (RU): Так что даже став взрослыми, они ощущали некоторую вину, когда приближались к часовне, независимо от причины, и испытывали некоторый страх, словно их отец может разъяриться и ударить их по лицу...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso, mesmo nesta idade, não importando a razão, ela sentiu alguma culpa em se aproximar da capela, e foi agarrada pelo medo, de que aquilo certamente deixaria o pai dela tão zangado que ele daria um tapa em seu rosto...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，樓座即便到了這個年紀，不管是加上什麼理由，只要一靠近這個禮拜堂，都還是會感到某種罪惡感，和必定會惹得父親憤怒到痛打自己臉頰的恐懼感…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，楼座即便到了这个年纪，不管是加上什么理由，只要一靠近这个礼拜堂，都还是会感到某种罪恶感，和必定会惹得父亲愤怒到痛打自己脸颊的恐惧感…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quindi anche se erano cresciuti, si sarebbero sentiti un po' in colpa se si fossero avvicinati alla cappella, indipendentemente dalla ragione, e provavano paura, come se il loro Padre si sarebbe arrabbiato e li avrebbe schiaffeggiati...
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Pertanto, anche quando ormai erano cresciuti, si sentivano in colpa ad approcciarsi alla cappella, a prescindere dalle loro ragioni... e temevano anche che loro padre si sarebbe sicuramente infuriato così tanto da colpirli sulle guance...
Turkish (TR): Dolayısıyla, bu yaşta bile, nedeni ne olursa olsun, kiliseye yaklaşırken biraz suçluluk duyuyor, ve bunun babasını kızdırıp suratına bir tokat atmasına neden olabileceği korkusuna kapılıyordu...

Steam (ST): The servants' silhouettes could be seen in front of the chapel's entrance. Gohda, Shannon and Kanon.
Umineko Project (UP): The servants' silhouettes could be seen in front of the entrance to the chapel.{n}Gohda, Shannon and Kanon.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The servants' silhouettes could be seen in front of the entrance to the chapel. Gohda, Shannon and Kanon.
PC Japanese (JP): 礼拝堂の入り口の前には、使用人たちの人影があった。郷田に紗音に嘉音。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 礼拝堂の入り口の前には、使用人たちの人影があった。{n}郷田に紗音に嘉音。
Russian (RU): Перед входом в часовню можно было разглядеть силуэты слуг.{n}Года, Шаннон и Канон.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): As silhuetas dos serviçais podiam ser vistas na frente da entrada da capela.{n}Gohda, Shannon e Kanon.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在禮拜堂門口，站立著傭人們的身影。{n}是鄉田、紗音，還有嘉音。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在礼拜堂门口，站立着佣人们的身影。{n}是乡田、纱音，还有嘉音。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): La sagoma dei domestici poteva essere scorta di fronte all'entrata della cappella. Gohda, Shannon e Kanon.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Di fronte all'entrata della cappella si intravedevano le sagome di un gruppo di domestici.{n}Gouda, Shannon e Kanon...
Turkish (TR): Hizmetkârların silüetleri kilisenin girişinin önünde görülebiliyordu.{n}Gohda, Shannon ve Kanon.

Steam (ST): ...Which meant that all of the servants on the morning shift had gathered.
Umineko Project (UP): ......Which meant that all of the servants on the morning shift had gathered.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……早番の使用人たちが全て集まっていることになる。
Russian (RU): ......Это значит, что собралась вся прислуга за утреннюю смену.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......O que significava que todos os serviçais no turno da manhã haviam se reunido.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……做早班的傭人已經全在這裡了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……做早班的佣人已经全在这里了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Il che significava che erano riuniti tutti i domestici del turno del mattino.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Tutti i domestici del turno del mattino erano radunati lì.
Turkish (TR): ......Bu da sabah vardiyasındaki tüm hizmetkârların burada toplandığı anlamına geliyordu.

Steam (ST): A short while ago, Genji had spoken to Rosa, telling her what the situation was. However, ...without laying eyes on it directly, she definitely hadn't been able to understand...
Umineko Project (UP): A short while ago, Rosa had been told the nature of the situation verbally by Genji. However, ...without laying eyes on it directly, she really hadn't been able to understand...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): A short while ago, Genji had spoken to Rosa, telling her what the situation was. However, ...without laying eyes on it directly, she really hadn't been able to understand it...
PC Japanese (JP): 楼座は源次に先ほど、どういう事態になっているのか口頭では聞かされていた。しかし、…実際に目にしなければ、とても理解できなかった…。
Russian (RU): Генджи совсем недавно поговорил с Розой, объяснив ей сложившуюся ситуацию. Вот только не увидев всё собственными глазами, она действительно была не в состоянии понять, что произошло...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Há um curto momento atrás, Genji havia informado verbalmente à Rosa a natureza da situação. Porém, ...sem ver a situação diretamente, ela realmente não havia sido capaz de entender...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 就在剛才，樓座有聽源次口頭講過是怎麼個事態。可是，…在自己親眼看到之前，她怎麼都沒能搞清楚狀況…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 就在刚才，楼座有听源次口头讲过是怎么个事态。可是，…在自己亲眼看到之前，她怎么都没能搞清楚状况…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Poco fa, Genji aveva parlato con Rosa, dicendole quale fosse la situazione. Tuttavia... senza vederlo con i propri occhi, lei non era davvero stata in grado di comprenderla...
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Poco prima, Rosa era stata informata da Genji sulla situazione corrente. Tuttavia... se non lo avesse visto con i suoi stessi occhi, non avrebbe potuto comprendere appieno l'accaduto...
Turkish (TR): Genji kısa bir süre önce Rosa'yla konuşmuş ve ona durumun ne olduğunu anlatmıştı. Ancak, ...doğrudan kendisi görmeden, bunu anlayabilmesi gerçekten mümkün değildi...

Steam (ST): It was probably the same for all the servants gathered here as well.
Umineko Project (UP): Probably, all of the servants gathered there were the same.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Probably, all of the servants gathered there were the same.
PC Japanese (JP): おそらく、集まっている使用人たちもみんなそうなのだ。
Russian (RU): Вероятно, вся прислуга собралась тут по той же причине.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Provavelmente, era o mesmo com todos os serviçais reunidos lá.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 恐怕，集合在這裡的傭人們也都是如此。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 恐怕，集合在这里的佣人们也都是如此。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Probabilmente, era così anche per tutti i domestici riuniti.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Probabilmente valeva anche per tutti i domestici lì riuniti...
Turkish (TR): Muhtemelen orada toplanan hizmetkârların hepsinin durumu aynıydı.

Steam (ST): ...{i:Without seeing it with their own eyes}, they wouldn't have been able to understand what was going on.
Umineko Project (UP): ......{i:Without seeing it with their own eyes}, they couldn't understand what was going on.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Without seeing it with their own eyes, they couldn't understand what was going on.
PC Japanese (JP): ……{i:自分の目で見なければ}、何が起こっているのか、理解できないのだ。
Russian (RU): {i:...Не увидев всё собственными глазами}, они не могли понять, что произошло.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......{i:Sem ver a situação com seus próprios olhos}, eles não conseguiam entender o que estava acontecendo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……{i:在自己親眼看到之前}，是搞不清發生了什麼事情的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……{i:在自己亲眼看到之前}，是搞不清发生了什么事情的。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Senza vederlo coi loro occhi, non potevano capire cosa stesse succedendo.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): {i:Se non lo avessero visto con i loro occhi}, non avrebbero potuto comprendere cosa stesse succedendo.
Turkish (TR): ......{i:Kendi gözleriyle görmeden} neler olup bittiğini anlayamamışlardı.

Steam (ST): On the door at the entrance to the chapel... was something very large, ...drawn with a creepy, stringy paint that made one think of blood... ...Something like a creepy magic circle.
Umineko Project (UP): Because, on the door that was the entrance to the chapel, ......drawn very large, ......with a creepy, sticky paint‐like substance that made one think of blood, ...was something like a creepy magic circle.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): On the door at the entrance to the chapel, was something very large, ...drawn with a creepy, stringy paint that made one think of blood, ...something like a creepy magic circle.
PC Japanese (JP): 礼拝堂の入り口の扉に、……大きく大きく、……血を思わせるネバついた不気味な塗料のようなもので、…不気味な魔法陣のようなものが描かれていたからだ。
Russian (RU): На дверях, ведущих внутрь часовни, находилось что‐то большое... Намазанное жуткой, волокнистой краской, наводящей на мысль о крови... Что‐то напоминающее жуткий магический круг.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Porque, na porta que servia de entrada para a capela, ......desenhado bem grande, ......com uma substância semelhante a alguma tinta suspeita e grudenta, que faria alguém pensar em sangue, ...estava algo como um círculo mágico macabro.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這是因為禮拜堂的大門上，……用黏糊糊的，……能讓人聯想到鮮血的恐怖塗料，大大地畫著一個，猶如陰森的魔法陣一般的圖形。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这是因为礼拜堂的大门上，……用黏糊糊的，……能让人联想到鲜血的恐怖涂料，大大地画着一个，犹如阴森的魔法阵一般的图形。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Sulla porta all'entrata della cappella, c'era qualcosa di molto largo... disegnato con una spaventosa vernice filamentosa che faceva pensare al sangue... qualcosa come uno spaventoso cerchio magico.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Sulla porta d'ingresso della cappella... vi era qualcosa di molto, molto grande... Una sorta di cerchio magico raccapricciante... tracciato con una vernice inquietante e collosa che ricordava del sangue.
Turkish (TR): Çünkü kilisenin girişi olan kapının üzerinde, ......oldukça büyük bir şekilde çizilmiş, ......tüyler ürpertici, yapışkan bir boyaya benzer ve insan kanını çağrıştıran bir maddeyle çizilmiş, ...tüyler ürpertici büyülü bir çembere benzer bir şey vardı.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rosa
Steam (ST): "Wh‐ What is... ...this...? When was it drawn here?!"
Umineko Project (UP): "Wh‐.........what is......this............? When was it drawn here?!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Wh, .........what is, ......this............? When was it drawn here?!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「な、………何よ、……これ…………。いつ書かれたの？！」
Russian (RU): "Чт... что же... это... Когда это появилось?!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "O‐.........O que é......isto............? Quando isso foi desenhado aqui?!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「這、………這是，……什麼呀…………。什麼時候畫上去的？！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「这、………这是，……什么呀…………。什么时候画上去的？！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "C... Che cos'è... questo...? Quando è stato disegnato qui?!"
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...C‐Che cos'è... questo...? Quand'è che è stato disegnato?!"

Steam (ST): The servants looked at each other. Gohda was the first to open his mouth.
Umineko Project (UP): The servants looked at each other.{n}Gohda was the first to open his mouth.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The servants looked at each other. Gohda was the first one to open his mouth.
PC Japanese (JP): 使用人たちは顔を見合わせる。最初に口を開いたのは郷田だった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 使用人たちは顔を見合わせる。{n}最初に口を開いたのは郷田だった。
Russian (RU): Слуги переглянулись.{n}Года стал первым, кто открыл рот.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Os serviçais se entreolharam.{n}Gohda foi o primeiro a abrir sua boca.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 傭人們不由得面面相覷。{n}第一個開口的是鄉田。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 佣人们不由得面面相觑。{n}第一个开口的是乡田。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): I domestici si guardarono l'un l'altro. Gohda fu il primo ad aprir bocca.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): I domestici si guardarono l'un l'altro.{n}Ad aprire bocca per primo fu Gouda.
Turkish (TR): Hizmetkârlar birbirlerine baktılar.{n}Ağzını ilk açan Gohda oldu.

Speaker: Gohda Toshiro
Steam (ST): "...M-My apologies. We don't usually enter this building, so we don't know when it was made."
Umineko Project (UP): "...My, ...my apologies. We do not usually trespass here, so we do not know when it was drawn."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "...M, ...my apologies. We do not usually enter here, so we do not know when it was drawn."
PC Japanese (JP): 「…も、…申し訳ございません。普段はここへは立ち入りませんもので、いつ書かれたのかはわかりません。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…も、…申し訳ございません。普段はここへは立ち入りませんもので、いつ書かれたのかはわかりません」
Russian (RU): "...М‐мои извинения. Обычно мы здесь не ходим, поэтому мы не можем сказать, когда это появилось здесь."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...Minhas, ...minhas desculpas. Geralmente não ultrapassamos este ponto, então não sabemos quando foi desenhado."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…非、…非常抱歉。平常我們是不會來這兒的，所以我們也不知道是什麼時候畫上去的。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…非、…非常抱歉。平常我们是不会来这儿的，所以我们也不知道是什么时候画上去的。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... L... Le mie scuse. Noi di solito non entriamo qui, quindi non sappiamo quando è stato disegnato."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "S-Sono mortificato. Generalmente non ci introduciamo in questo luogo, per cui non sappiamo quando sia stato apposto."
Turkish (TR): "...Ö-Özür dilerim. Genellikle buradan izinsiz geçmeyiz, bu yüzden ne zaman çizildiğini bilmiyoruz."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rosa
Steam (ST): "Then who was the first person to find it?!"
Umineko Project (UP): "Then, who was the first person to find it?!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「じゃあ、最初に見つけたのは誰？！」
Russian (RU): "Тогда кто был первым человеком, обнаружившим это?!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Então, quem foi a primeira pessoa a encontrar isto?!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「那，第一個看到這個的是誰？！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「那，第一个看到这个的是谁？！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Allora, chi è stata la prima persona a trovarlo?!"
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Allora chi è stato il primo a scoprirlo?!"
Turkish (TR): "O zaman onu ilk bulan kimdi?!"

Speaker: Shannon
Steam (ST): "I-It was me. ...When I went to the dining hall to clean up the tea set, ...I found a memo with "chapel" written on it..."
Umineko Project (UP): "Tha‐...that was me. ......When I went to the dining hall to clean away the tea set, ......there was a memo with "chapel" written on it..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Y, ...yes, it was me. ......When I went to the dining hall to clean up the tea set, ......there was a memo with 'chapel' written on it..."
PC Japanese (JP): 「はッ、…はい、私です。……食堂へお茶の道具の片付けに行きましたら、……礼拝堂と書かれたメモがあったもので…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「はッ、…はい、私です。……食堂へお茶の道具の片付けに行きましたら、……礼拝堂と書かれたメモがあったもので…」
Russian (RU): "Д‐да, это была я. ......Когда я пошла в столовую, чтобы убрать чайный сервиз... там была записка, на которой было написано 'часовня'..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "F‐Fui eu. ......Quando fui à sala de jantar para limpar o jogo de chá, ......havia um bilhete no qual estava escrito "capela"..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「是、…是，是我。……我去餐廳收拾茶具的時候，……找到了張寫著禮拜堂的便條…」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「是、…是，是我。……我去餐厅收拾茶具的时候，……找到了张写着礼拜堂的便条…」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "S... Sì, sono stata io. ... Quando sono andata nella sala da pranzo per pulire il set da tè... c'era un appunto con scritto ‘cappella’ sopra di esso..."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "E-Eccomi, sono stata io... Quando sono andata nella sala da pranzo per sistemare il set da tè... ho trovato un appunto in cui c'era scritto ‘cappella’..."
Turkish (TR): "B-...Bendim. ......Çay setini toplmak için yemek salonuna gittiğimde, ......üzerinde "kilise" yazan bir not vardı..."

Steam (ST): Shannon held out the memo with a shaking hand.
Umineko Project (UP): Shannon held out the memo with a shaking hand.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 樓座確信了。{n}……不會錯的。{n}……真里亞拿到的那個信封…………。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 楼座确信了。{n}……不会错的。{n}……真里亚拿到的那个信封…………。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Rosa ne era certa. ... Non poteva sbagliarsi. ... Quella lettera che era stata data a Maria...
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Rosa ne era convinta...{n}Non poteva essersi sbagliata...{n}La lettera che era stata data a Maria...
Turkish (TR): Rosa ikna olmuştu.{n}......Buna hiç şüphe yoktu.{n}......Maria'nın eline tutuşturulan o mektup............

Steam (ST): After dashing back to the guesthouse, Rosa approached the cousins' room while hiding her footsteps, softly opened the door, and peered inside...
Umineko Project (UP): After dashing back to the guesthouse, Rosa approached the cousins' room while hiding her footsteps, softly opened the door, and peered inside...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): After dashing back to the guesthouse, Rosa approached the cousins' room while hiding her footsteps, softly opened the door, and peered inside...
PC Japanese (JP): 楼座はゲストハウスへ駆けて戻ると、足音を忍ばせながらいとこ部屋に近付き、そっと扉を開け、中をうかがう…。
Russian (RU): Прибежав в домик для гостей, Роза, скрывая свои шаги, приблизилась к комнате кузенов, тихо приоткрыла дверь и заглянула внутрь...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Depois de correr de volta à casa de hóspedes, Rosa se aproximou do quarto dos primos enquanto ocultava seus passos, suavemente abriu a porta, e olhou para dentro...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 樓座跑回了賓館，壓低腳步聲來到了堂兄妹房間門前，輕手輕腳地打開了門，向裡面張望著…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 楼座跑回了宾馆，压低脚步声来到了堂兄妹房间门前，轻手轻脚地打开了门，向里面张望着…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Dopo aver corso alla casa degli ospiti, Rosa si avvicinò alla stanza dei cugini soffocando i propri passi, aprì leggermente la porta, e sbirciò dentro...
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Una volta tornata di corsa alla dépendance, Rosa si approcciò alla stanza dei cugini, coprendo nel mentre il rumore dei suoi passi, aprì con delicatezza la porta, e sbirciò dentro la stanza...
Turkish (TR): Rosa konukevine koşarak geri döndükten sonra, ayak seslerini gizleyerek kuzenlerinin odasına yaklaştı, usulca kapıyı açtı ve içeriye baktı...

Steam (ST): From the inside, she could hear the healthy snores typical of young people.
Umineko Project (UP): From the inside, she could hear the healthy snores of young people.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): From the inside, she could hear the healthy snores of young people.
PC Japanese (JP): 中からは、若者らしい元気のいいいびきが聞こえてきた。
Russian (RU): Она услышала здоровый храп молодых людей, доносящийся изнутри.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): De dentro, ela pôde ouvir os roncos saudáveis de pessoas jovens.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 從房間裡傳來了年輕人富有朝氣的鼾聲。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 从房间里传来了年轻人富有朝气的鼾声。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Dall'interno, poteva sentire il sano russare dei giovani.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Dall'interno si potevano udire i giovanotti ronfare rumorosamente.
Turkish (TR): İçeriden, genç insanlara özgü sağlıklı horlamaları duyabiliyordu.

Steam (ST): There were four children. And Maria was there. ...Sleeping soundly.
Umineko Project (UP): The four children were all there. Maria was there. ...Sleeping soundly.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): There were four children. And Maria was there. ...Sleeping soundly.
PC Japanese (JP): 子どもたちは４人いる。真里亞もいる。…すやすやと眠っていた。
Russian (RU): Здесь было четверо детей. И Мария среди них. ...Крепко спящая.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): As quatro crianças estavam todas ali. Maria estava ali. ...Dormindo profundamente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 房間中有四個孩子。真里亞也在。…都在甜甜地睡著。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 房间中有四个孩子。真里亚也在。…都在甜甜地睡着。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): C'erano quattro ragazzi. E Maria era lì. ... Dormendo rumorosamente.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): C'erano quattro ragazzi. Maria era una di questi... E stava dormendo profondamente.
Turkish (TR): Dört çocuğun hepsi oradaydı. Maria da oradaydı. ...Mışıl mışıl uyuyordu.

Steam (ST): After breathing a sigh of relief, she entered the room with quiet footsteps. ...She was after Maria's handbag, which was resting on the sofa.
Umineko Project (UP): After heaving a sigh of relief, she entered the room with quiet footsteps.{n}......She was after Maria's handbag, which was resting on the sofa.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): After feeling relieved, she entered the room with quiet footsteps.......She was after Maria's handbag, which was resting on the sofa.
PC Japanese (JP): ほっと胸を撫で下ろしてから、忍び足で室内に入る。……目指すのは、ソファーの上に置かれている真里亞の手提げだった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ほっと胸を撫で下ろしてから、忍び足で室内に入る。{n}……目指すのは、ソファーの上に置かれている真里亞の手提げだった。
Russian (RU): Почувствовав облегчение, Роза тихими шагами вошла в комнату.{n}......Она подошла к сумке Марии, лежавшей на диване.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Depois de dar um suspiro de alívio, ela adentrou o quarto com passos silenciosos.{n}......Ela estava atrás da bolsa de Maria, a qual estava descansando no sofá.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 樓座鬆了口氣，安下了提著的心後，躡手躡腳地走了進去。{n}……她的目標，是放在沙發上的真里亞的手提包。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 楼座松了口气，安下了提着的心后，蹑手蹑脚地走了进去。{n}……她的目标，是放在沙发上的真里亚的手提包。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Dopo essersi tranquillizzata, entrò nella stanza con passo leggero. ... Stava cercando la borsa di Maria, che era poggiata sul divano.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Dopo aver tirato un sospiro di sollievo, si introdusse in camera con passo felpato... I suoi occhi miravano alla borsetta di Maria, che era stata poggiata sul divano.
Turkish (TR): Rahat bir nefes aldıktan sonra sessiz adımlarla odaya girdi.{n}......Maria'nın kanepenin üzerinde duran el çantasının peşindeydi.

Steam (ST): Maria always liked carrying her treasures around with her. ...She was probably emulating how her mother always carried her makeup with her.
Umineko Project (UP): Maria always liked walking around with her treasures.{n}...She was probably imitating how her mother always carried her makeup with her.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Maria always liked walking around with her treasures....She was probably imitating how her mother always carried her makeup with her.
PC Japanese (JP): 真里亞は、自分の宝物をいつも持ち歩きたがる。…母親が常に化粧道具を肌身離さず持ち歩いていることの模倣だろう。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 真里亞は、自分の宝物をいつも持ち歩きたがる。{n}…母親が常に化粧道具を肌身離さず持ち歩いていることの模倣だろう。
Russian (RU): Мария всегда любила носить в ней свои сокровища.{n}...Возможно так она подражала своей матери, всегда берущей с собой косметичку.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Maria sempre gostava de andar por aí com seus tesouros.{n}...Ela provavelmente estava imitando o jeito como sua mãe sempre carregava a maquiagem consigo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 真里亞很喜歡把自己的寶物帶在身邊。{n}…這應該是在模仿母親總是隨身攜帶化妝品的習慣吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 真里亚很喜欢把自己的宝物带在身边。{n}…这应该是在模仿母亲总是随身携带化妆品的习惯吧。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): A Maria piaceva sempre portarsi dietro i suoi tesori. ... Lei probabilmente imitava il fatto che sua Madre portasse sempre i trucchi con lei.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): A Maria era sempre piaciuto portarsi dietro i suoi tesori...{n}Probabilmente era per imitare sua madre, che aveva sempre con sé il suo kit per il trucco.
Turkish (TR): Maria her zaman değerli eşyalarıyla dolaşmayı severdi.{n}...Muhtemelen annesinin makyaj malzemelerini her zaman yanında taşımasını taklit ediyordu.

Steam (ST): Of course, she was just imitating her mother, so everything on the inside was junk.
Umineko Project (UP): Of course, she was just copying her, so on the inside, it was full of junk.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Of course, she was just copying her, so on the inside, it was full of junk.
PC Japanese (JP): もちろん、単なる物真似だから、その中身はがらくたばかりだ。
Russian (RU): Разумеется, она просто копировала её, потому что внутри сумки лежала куча хлама.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): É claro, ela estava apenas a copiando, logo, seu interior estava cheio de tralhas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 當然，畢竟只是看樣學樣而已，所以包裡裝的全是些沒用的破爛。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 当然，毕竟只是看样学样而已，所以包里装的全是些没用的破烂。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Ovviamente la stava semplicemente copiando, per cui il contenuto della borsetta era costituito solo da cianfrusaglie.
Turkish (TR): Tabii ki, sadece onu taklit ediyordu, yani içi ıvır zıvır doluydu.

Steam (ST): In Maria's case, it was full of small, creepy, occult items, notebooks describing things of that nature, and so on.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): In Maria's case, it was full of small, creepy, occult-like items, and a notebook with things like that written on it.
PC Japanese (JP): 真里亞の場合は、オカルトを想起させる不気味な小物や、それが記された自由帳などだ。
Russian (RU): У Марии в ней хранилась куча мелких, жутких, около‐оккультных предметов и записная книжка со всеми её записями.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): No caso de Maria, ela estava cheia de itens pequenos, macabros, ocultistas e um caderno com coisas como aquelas escritas nele.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 而真里亞的包裡，就放著些讓人聯想到神秘學的嚇人小玩意，還有把這些記錄在案的雜記本等等。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 而真里亚的包里，就放着些让人联想到神秘学的吓人小玩意，还有把这些记录在案的杂记本等等。

Steam (ST): ...Rosa had never been happy to see her daughter walking around with things like that, which weren't girlish at all.
Umineko Project (UP): ......Rosa hadn't once been happy to see her daughter walking around with those kinds of ungirlish things.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Rosa hadn't been happy once to see her daughter walking around with those kinds of things, which were not girlish.
PC Japanese (JP): ……こんな女の子らしくないものを、楼座は持ち歩いて欲しいなどと思ったことは一度もない。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Rosa nunca ficaria feliz vendo sua filha andando por aí com esse tipo de coisa nada feminino.

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Rosa non era mai stata contenta di vederla andare in giro con oggetti che non si addicevano ad una ragazzina.

Steam (ST): However, trying to force Maria to stop had resulted in a big fight, so she'd decided to let it be.
Umineko Project (UP): However, after she had tried to force Maria to stop, they had gotten into a big fight, and she had decided to let it be.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, after she tried to force Maria to stop, they had gotten into a big fight, and she had decided to let it be.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、無理にやめさせようとして、ものすごい大喧嘩をして以来、それには触れないようにしていた。
Russian (RU): Однако после того, как она попыталась отучить Марию от этого, она встретила такой отпор, что решила оставить всё как есть.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Porém, depois de ter tentado forçar Maria a parar, elas tiveram uma grande briga, e ela acabou decidindo deixar por isso.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过，在硬是要她改掉而大吵了一架之后，楼座就不再去过问了。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Tuttavia, dopo aver provato a costringere Maria a smetterla, scatenando così un'enorme litigata tra loro due, decise di lasciar perdere.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rosa

Steam (ST): ...She could tell by its feel and its weight. ...There was no doubt. This was...a key.
Umineko Project (UP): ...She could tell by its feel and its weight.{n}......There was no doubt.{n}This was......a key.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...She could tell by its feel and its weight.......There was no doubt. This was, ......a key.
PC Japanese (JP): …重さと手触りでわかる。……間違いない。これは、……鍵だ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …重さと手触りでわかる。{n}……間違いない。{n}これは、……鍵だ。

Turkish (TR): ...Hissinden ve ağırlığından anlayabiliyordu.{n}......Şüphe yoktu.{n}Bu......bir anahtardı.

Steam (ST): After turning around and checking that Maria was still sound asleep, Rosa tore open the envelope, and the contents spilled out into her palm.
Umineko Project (UP): After turning around and checking that Maria was still sound asleep, Rosa tore open the envelope, and tipped out the contents into her palm.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): After turning around and checking that Maria was still sound asleep, Rosa tore open the envelope, and the contents spilled out into her palm.
PC Japanese (JP): 楼座は、一度振り返り、真里亞が熟睡しているのを確認した後、一息に封筒を破き、中身を手の平の上に零した。
Russian (RU): Затем оглянувшись вокруг и убедившись, что Мария всё ещё крепко спит, Роза вскрыла конверт и вывалила его содержимое на ладонь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Depois de olhar em volta, e verificar que Maria ainda estava dormindo profundamente, Rosa rasgou o envelope e entornou o conteúdo na palma de sua mão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 樓座回頭看了一眼，確認了真里亞還熟睡著後，一口氣撕破了信封，把信封裡面的東西倒在了手掌上。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 楼座回头看了一眼，确认了真里亚还熟睡着后，一口气撕破了信封，把信封里面的东西倒在了手掌上。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Dopo essersi girata e aver controllato che Maria stesse ancora dormendo, Rosa aprì la busta e ne riversò il contenuto sul suo palmo.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Dopo essersi girata con la testa e aver controllato che Maria fosse ancora in un sonno profondo, Rosa strappò la busta in un colpo solo, e fece cadere il suo contenuto sul suo palmo...

Steam (ST): ...It was a key with an old and intricate design... Rosa gripped that key and dashed out.
Umineko Project (UP): ......It was a key with an old and intricate design...{n}Rosa grasped that key, and dashed out.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......It was a key with an old and intricate design... Rosa grasped that key, and dashed out.
PC Japanese (JP): ……それは、古く凝った意匠の施された鍵だった…。楼座はその鍵を握り締め、駆け出していく。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……それは、古く凝った意匠の施された鍵だった…。{n}楼座はその鍵を握り締め、駆け出していく。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Era uma chave com um desenho velho e intrincado...{n}Rosa agarrou a chave, e correu para fora.

Chinese Simplified (CN): ……这是一把做工考究的老旧钥匙…。{n}楼座紧握着这钥匙，跑出了房间。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Era una chiave ornata da un vecchio motivo intricato...{n}Rosa strinse con forza la chiave, per poi correre fuori...
Turkish (TR): ......Eski ve karmaşık bir tasarımı olan bir anahtardı...{n}Rosa anahtarı kavradı ve dışarı fırladı.

Steam (ST): ...Battler seemed to have noticed that sound, but after grumbling and turning over in his sleep, he started snoring again...
Umineko Project (UP): ...It seemed that Battler noticed those sounds, but after grumbling and turning over in his sleep, he started snoring again...

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Elas podiam ser reconhecidas de relance.{n}Krauss e sua esposa, Eva e seu marido, Rudolf e sua esposa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 一看就知道是誰。{n}是藏臼夫婦、繪羽夫婦，還有留弗夫夫婦。

Steam (ST): But if you wanted to be sure, you'd still have to go even closer and check.
Umineko Project (UP): But if you were asked if these were definitely them, you'd still have to go even closer to check.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But if someone told you that, you'd still have to go even closer and check.

Russian (RU): Но даже если бы кто‐нибудь вам это сказал, вам бы всё равно пришлось подойти поближе и самому убедиться.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Para ter certeza que definitivamente eram eles, você teria que chegar ainda mais perto para checar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過，要是被人問起這是否毫無疑問肯定是他們，那就必須再靠近點看看才能知道。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过，要是被人问起这是否毫无疑问肯定是他们，那就必须再靠近点看看才能知道。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ma se ti fosse stato detto da qualcuno, dovresti andare ancora più vicino a controllare.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Ma se qualcuno avesse voluto avere la certezza assoluta, avrebbe dovuto avvicinarsi di più per poterlo verificare...
Turkish (TR): Ancak size bunların kesinlikle onlar olup olmadığı sorulsaydı, kontrol etmek için daha da yaklaşmanız gerekirdi.

Umineko Project (UP): ......Because they seemed almost like dolls.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Chinese Simplified (CN): ……而这是因为，他们这副样子，简直就跟人偶一样。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Perché ricordavano quasi dei pupazzi.

Steam (ST): Rosa and the rest had opened the door, entered all at once with the sound of many footsteps, and called out, asking if anyone was there.
Umineko Project (UP): Rosa and the rest had opened the door, entered all at once with the sound of many footsteps, and called out, asking if anyone was there.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Rosa and the rest had opened the door, entered all at once with the sound of many footsteps, and called out, asking if anyone was there.
PC Japanese (JP): 扉を開き、どやどやと入り込み、誰かいないかと声を掛けた。
Russian (RU): Открыв дверь, Роза со слугами вошли внутрь, наполнив часовню звуками многочисленных шагов, и стали звать, есть ли здесь кто‐нибудь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Rosa e os serviçais tinham aberto a porta, todos entrando de uma vez com o som de muitos passos, e chamado, perguntando se alguém estava ali.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 打開了門，蜂擁而入了那麼多人，還大喊過了有沒有人在。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 打开了门，蜂拥而入了那么多人，还大喊过了有没有人在。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Rosa e gli altri aprirono la porta, entrarono tutti insieme con il rumore di molti passi, e gridarono, chiedendo se ci fosse qualcuno.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Quando la porta si aprì, tutti entrarono insieme con gran scalpitare, gridando se ci fosse qualcuno...
Turkish (TR): Rosa ve diğerleri kapıyı açmış, çok sayıda ayak sesiyle bir anda içeri girmiş ve seslenerek orada kimsenin olup olmadığını sormuşlardı.

Steam (ST): ...And yet, there had been no reaction. ...Even if Rosa and the rest assumed they were being ignored, you'd still expect there to be some kind of reaction.
Umineko Project (UP): ...And yet, there had been no reaction. ...Even assuming they had chosen to ignore them, normally you'd expect there to be some kind of reaction.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...And yet, there had been no reaction....Even if Rosa and the rest assumed that they were being ignored, normally you'd expect there to be some kind of reaction.
PC Japanese (JP): …にもかかわらず、何の反応も示さない。…仮に無視を決め込んでいたとしても、普通なら少しは何かの反応を示す。
Russian (RU): ...И всё равно никакой реакции не последовало. ...Даже допусти Роза и остальные, что их игнорируют, хоть какая‐то реакция всё равно должна была последовать.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Mesmo assim, não houve reação. ...E mesmo assumindo que eles haviam escolhido ignorá‐los, normalmente você esperaria haver algum tipo de reação.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …可儘管如此，他們卻沒有任何反應。…假如就算是鐵下心要無視一切，一般也會做出點小小的反應才是。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …可尽管如此，他们却没有任何反应。…假如就算是铁下心要无视一切，一般也会做出点小小的反应才是。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Nonostante ciò, non vi fu alcuna reazione. ... Anche se Rosa e gli altri supposero di essere stati ignorati, di solito ci si aspetterebbe di ricevere un tipo di reazione.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Ciononostante, non vi fu alcuna replica... Di solito ci sarebbe stata una reazione di qualche tipo, anche se avessero fatto finta di ignorarli...
Turkish (TR): ...Ama yine de hiçbir tepki gelmemişti. ...Onları görmezden gelmeyi seçtiklerini varsaysak bile, normalde bir tür tepki vermelerini beklersiniz.

Steam (ST): ...And there hadn't even been that.
Umineko Project (UP): ......And there hadn't even been that.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……可就連這都沒有。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……可就连这都没有。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Non avvenne neanche ciò.
Turkish (TR): ......Ve bu bile olmamıştı.

Umineko Project (UP): So at first, it felt like someone had set down some dolls that looked a lot like them...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So at first, it felt like someone had set down some dolls that looked a lot like them...

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Per cui, la prima cosa che pensarono fu che qualcuno avesse messo dei fantocci molto rassomiglianti a loro...

Umineko Project (UP): ......By now, it wasn't just Rosa.{n}......Shannon and Kanon, and even Gohda.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......By now, it wasn't just Rosa.......Shannon and Kanon, and even Gohda.

Steam (ST): ...They were all fighting frantically with the creepy emotion that grasped their hearts.
Umineko Project (UP): ...They were all fighting frantically against the rising creepy emotion tightly grasping their hearts.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...They were all fighting frantically with the creepy emotion that grasped their hearts.
PC Japanese (JP): …湧き上がる不気味な感情に心臓が鷲掴みにされるような気持ちと必死に戦っていた。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Todos estavam lutando freneticamente contra a crescente emoção macabra agarrando seus corações.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......They were not dolls, she accepted that they were those very people......!

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Si avvicinò quel tanto che bastava per comprendere chiaramente cosa vi fosse sul tavolo.

Steam (ST): It still looked like an adorable banquet, reminiscent of a child's birthday party.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): Just like their first impression, it looked like a lovely banquet, reminiscent of a child's birthday party.
PC Japanese (JP): それは、第一印象の通り、子どものお誕生会かパーティを思わせるような、可愛らしい宴に見えた。
Russian (RU): Первое впечатление не обмануло их. Это было похоже на роскошное застолье, напоминающее вечеринку в честь дня рождения ребёнка.

Umineko Project (UP): Plates piled up with sweets, glasses with lovely drinks.{n}Several ornaments in the shape of pumpkins...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Plates piled up with sweets, glasses with lovely drinks. Several ornaments in the shape of pumpkins...

Steam (ST): ...They were all decorated in a Halloween style, ...and while this probably wasn't the time to be thinking it, Maria would surely have been delighted to see all this.
Umineko Project (UP): ...They were all decorated in a Halloween style, ...and while it might have been an irrelevant thought at a time like this, ...she thought that this would surely make Maria happy if she could see it.

PC Japanese (JP): …それらはハロウィン風に飾られていて、…こんな時に的外れな想像だが…、きっと真里亞が見たら喜ぶに違いないと思った。
Russian (RU): ...Все они были украшены в стиле Хэллоуин... И хотя подобная мысль была неуместна в такое время, Роза подумала, что, наверное, Мария бы обрадовалась, если бы увидела это.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Todos eles estavam decorados ao estilo do Halloween, ...e ainda que isso pudesse ser um pensamento irrelevante em uma hora dessas, ...ela pensou que tal coisa certamente deixaria Maria feliz se ela pudesse ver.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Balas e biscoitos, {i:ramune} e chocolates.........tinham vazado, manchados com sangue, e haviam escorrido pelo piso!!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 糖和餅乾，汽水和巧克力，……溢出他們的肚子，沾滿鮮血，傾倒在了地板上！！
Chinese Simplified (CN): 糖和饼干，汽水和巧克力，……溢出他们的肚子，沾满鲜血，倾倒在了地板上！！
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Caramelle e biscotti, seltz e cioccolati... colarono, macchiati di sangue, e si sparse sul pavimento!!
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Caramelle, biscotti, confettini al limone, cioccolata... Colavano giù macchiati di sangue, per poi disseminarsi sul pavimento!!
Turkish (TR): Şekerler ve kurabiyeler, jelibonlar ve çikolatalar.........dışarı taşmış, kana bulanmış ve etrafa dağılmıştı!!

Steam (ST): What could have happened to cause this?!
Umineko Project (UP): What could have happened to cause this?!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=ST]
PC Japanese (JP): どんなことをしたらこういうことに？！
Russian (RU): Что могло стать причиной этого?!
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O que poderia ter acontecido para causar isto?!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 要怎麼做才會變成這樣？！
Chinese Simplified (CN): 要怎么做才会变成这样？！
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Cosa può aver causato ciò?!
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Cosa poteva aver causato qualcosa di simile?!
Turkish (TR): Buna sebep olacak ne olmuş olabilir?!

Steam (ST): It's almost as though their stomachs were stuffed full to bursting with sweets... and it all poured out when their stomachs split open!!
Umineko Project (UP): It was almost as though the insides of their stomachs had been stuffed full with sweets, ......and when their stomachs had been cut, it had all flowed out!!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was almost as though the insides of their stomachs had been stuffed full with sweets, ......and when their stomachs had been cut, it had all flowed out?!!
PC Japanese (JP): まるで、お腹の中にお菓子がいっぱいに膨れ上がって、……お腹を裂いたら溢れ出したみたいじゃないかッ！！
Russian (RU): Как будто их животы были набиты кучей сладостей, а когда их вскрыли, то они высыпались?!
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Era quase como se o interior de seus estômagos tivesse sido estufado com doces, ......e quando suas barrigas haviam sido cortadas, tudo tinha fluído para fora!!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這不簡直就像是，用糖果把他們肚子撐得大大的，……剖開肚皮之後，這些東西就一下子溢出來了似的嗎！！
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这不简直就像是，用糖果把他们肚子撑得大大的，……剖开肚皮之后，这些东西就一下子溢出来了似的吗！！
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Era come se l'interno dei loro stomaci fosse stato rimpinzato con i dolci... e quando vennero tagliati, ne uscì tutto fuori?!!
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Era come se l'interno della loro pancia fosse stato imbottito di dolcetti fino all'orlo... e una volta tranciate, fossero straripati via!!
Turkish (TR): Sanki midelerinin içi şekerle doldurulmuş, ......ve karınları kesildiğinde hepsi dışarı akmış gibiydi!!

Steam (ST): Rosa remembered a certain shocking meal, a turkey that had been served at her own birthday.
Umineko Project (UP): Rosa remembered a gross‐out meal, a turkey that had been served at her own birthday when she was a young girl.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Rosa remembered a shocking meal, a turkey that had been served at her own birthday.
PC Japanese (JP): 楼座は子どもの頃、自分の誕生会に出てきた七面鳥のびっくり料理を思い出す。
Russian (RU): Роза вспомнила однажды шокировавшее её блюдо, индейку, которая была подана на её день рождения.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Rosa se lembrou de uma refeição nojenta, um peru que tinha sido servido em seu próprio aniversário quando ela era jovem.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 樓座想起了小時候，自己慶生會時端上來過的驚喜火雞。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 楼座想起了小时候，自己庆生会时端上来过的惊喜火鸡。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Rosa ricordò un disgustoso pranzo, un tacchino che fu servito per il suo compleanno.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Rosa si ricordò quando, da piccola, le fu servito a sorpresa un tacchino alla sua festa di compleanno.
Turkish (TR): Rosa, genç bir kızken kendi doğum gününde servis edilen iğrenç bir yemeği, bir hindiyi hatırladı.

Steam (ST): When it had been cut open with a knife, ...out flowed one of her favorite foods. ...But since she hadn't been told what was inside, the deep, deep red ketchup omelet-rice poured out like bloody maggots... pulsing, dripping, slimy, pulpy, squelching!!
Umineko Project (UP): When she had put the knife in, ......from the inside, her very favorite—but because no one had told her about it at all—bright‐red—bright‐red—ketchup omelet‐rice had...poured out like blood‐stained maggots, buwaa, dripping, slimy, pulpy, sticky!!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When it had been cut with a knife, ......from the inside, things she loved, but which she had not heard about at all, ...bright-red, bright-red, ...ketchup omelet-rice had poured out like blood-stained maggots, buwaa, dripping, slimy, pulpy, sticky!!
PC Japanese (JP): ナイフを入れて裂いたら、……中から大好物の、だけれどもそんなことは全然聞いてなかったから、…真っ赤な、真っ赤な、…ケチャップのオムライスが血まみれの蛆虫のように溢れ出して、ぶわあぼろぼろびたびたぐちゃぐちゃべしゃりべちゃり！！
Russian (RU): Когда её разрезали ножом, то изнутри... Роза любила рисовый омлет, но её не предупредили об этом... Изнутри потек ярко‐красный, смешанный с кетчупом рисовый омлет, напоминавший окровавленные личинки, буэ‐э! Стекающие, склизкие, мясистые, липкие личинки!
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Depois de colocar a faca dentro e puxar... era seu prato favorito, mas ninguém havia lhe dito nada sobre aquilo—o vermelho profundamente escarlate, como ketchup derramado sobre uma omelete com arroz... derramado como vermes manchados de sangue, pulsando, pingando, gosmento, polposo, grudento!!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 用餐刀切開，……裡面就會冒出小壽星最愛吃的東西……，可是由於她事先根本沒聽人說過，…因而那血紅血紅的，…沾滿番茄醬的蛋包飯，就如同渾身是血的蛆虫般地溢了出來，軟軟的爛爛的黏黏的糊糊的啪嚓啪嚓！！
Chinese Simplified (CN): 用餐刀切开，……里面就会冒出小寿星最爱吃的东西……，可是由于她事先根本没听人说过，…因而那血红血红的，…沾满番茄酱的蛋包饭，就如同浑身是血的蛆虫般地溢了出来，软软的烂烂的黏黏的糊糊的啪嚓啪嚓！！
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quando venne tagliato con un coltello... dalle interiora, le cose che adorava, ma di cui non aveva mai sentito nulla... di un rosso vivo, rosso vivo... la frittata di riso al ketchup colò come vermi macchiati di sangue, buwaa, gocciolante, viscida, polposa, appiccicosa!!
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Quando venne affettato con un coltello... dal suo interno sgorgò fuori il suo cibo preferito, ma non essendole stato detto nulla... l'omelette di riso con ketchup, che aveva un colore incredibilmente rosso vivo... le era sembrata una frotta di larve insanguinate... Bleah, sgocciolavano, erano inzuppate, carnose, fangose!!
Turkish (TR): Bıçağı sapladığında, ......içinden en sevdiği yiyeceklerden biri olan—ama ona kimse bundan bahsetmemişti—parlak—kırmızı—ketçaplı—pilavlı omlet...kana bulanmış kurtçuklar gibi, titreyen, damlayan, yapış yapış, posalı, ve yapışkan bir şekilde dışarı akmıştı!!

Steam (ST): The trauma of her youth was revived. Rosa felt a monster raging inside her stomach as the acid started to rise.
Umineko Project (UP): The trauma of her youth was revived. Rosa felt a monster raging inside her stomach, as the acid started to rise up.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 幼少期のトラウマが蘇る。楼座の胃の中で怪物が暴れ狂い、熱い酸を吹き上げるのを感じた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 幼少期のトラウマが蘇る。楼座の胃の中で怪物が暴れくるい、熱い酸を吹き上げるのを感じた。
Russian (RU): Травма её юности снова дала о себе знать. Роза ощутила, как монстр забушевал в её желудке, как стремительно накатило чувство тошноты.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O trauma de sua juventude foi revivido. Rosa sentiu um monstro urrando dentro de sua barriga, enquanto o ácido gástrico começava a subir.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 幼年時的精神創傷甦醒了。樓座感到自己胃中有怪物狂鬧，喉頭涌上了熱呼呼的酸水。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 幼年时的精神创伤苏醒了。楼座感到自己胃中有怪物狂闹，喉头涌上了热呼呼的酸水。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Il trauma della sua giovinezza fu riesumato. Rosa sentì un mostro furioso dentro il suo stomaco, e l'acido iniziò a salire.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Il suo trauma giovanile venne riesumato. Nello stomaco di Rosa, la quale sentiva dell'acido bollente risalirle in bocca, si stava rivoltando un mostro...
Turkish (TR): Gençliğinde yaşadığı travma yeniden canlanmıştı. Rosa, midesindeki asit yükselmeye başladığında içinde bir canavarın alevlendiğini hissetti.

Steam (ST): ...Unable to hold back, she threw it all up on the floor.
Umineko Project (UP): ...Unable to hold back, she threw up on the floor.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …そして堪らず、床にそれを吐き出す。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Incapaz de se conter, ela vomitou no piso.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …然後她忍不住，將這些吐到了地板上。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …然后她忍不住，将这些吐到了地板上。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Senza potersi trattenere, vomitò sul pavimento.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Dopodiché, vomitò sul pavimento, senza riuscire a trattenersi.

Steam (ST): Her empty stomach had nothing but stomach acid.
Umineko Project (UP): Her empty stomach couldn't throw up anything but stomach acid.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Her empty stomach couldn't throw up anything but stomach acid.
PC Japanese (JP): 空腹の胃袋は胃液しか吐き出さなかった。
Russian (RU): Её пустой желудок не мог извергнуть ничего, кроме желудочной кислоты.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Seu estômago vazio não conseguia vomitar nada além de ácido gástrico.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 空腹的胃只能讓她吐出胃液。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 空腹的胃只能让她吐出胃液。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Il suo stomaco vuoto non potè che vomitare succhi gastrici.
Turkish (TR): Boş midesi mide asidinden başka bir şey kusamıyordu.

Steam (ST): The scene in front of her was no fun Halloween party now...!
Umineko Project (UP): This scene in front of her was no longer a fun Halloween party by any means...!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): This scene in front of her was no longer a fun Halloween party...!
PC Japanese (JP): もう目の前の光景は楽しいハロウィンパーティなどでは断じてない…！
Russian (RU): Эта сцена перед ней больше не была весёлым праздником Хэллоуин!..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A cena à sua frente não era mais uma festa divertida de Halloween de jeito nenhum...!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 眼前的光景已斷然不是什麼快樂的萬聖夜派對了…！
Chinese Simplified (CN): 眼前的光景已断然不是什么快乐的万圣夜派对了…！
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Questa scena di fronte a lei non era più un party di Halloween...!
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Era ormai evidente che quella scena davanti ai suoi occhi non era una piacevole festa di Halloween...!
Turkish (TR): Önündeki bu sahne artık hiçbir şekilde eğlenceli bir Cadılar Bayramı partisi değildi...!

Steam (ST): The three couples were enshrined right there, their stomachs vertically wrenched open, wrenched open with a gyuiiiiiiigubaaa.
Umineko Project (UP): The three couples had been placed there, with their stomachs vertically wrenched open, wrenched open with a gyuiiiiiiigupaaa.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The three couples had been placed there, with their stomachs vertically wrenched open, wrenched open with a gyuiiiiiiigubaaa.
PC Japanese (JP): ６人の夫婦が鎮座し、腹を縦に抉じ開けられ、ぎゅぃいいぃぐぱああと抉じ開けられて。
Russian (RU): Здесь сидели три пары с вертикально распоротыми животами, распоротыми... Буэ‐э!
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Os três casais haviam sido colocados ali, com suas barrigas abertas verticalmente distendidas, abertas distendidas com um gyuiiiiiiigupaaa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 三對夫婦端坐著，被縱向破開了腹部，嗤啦一下挖開了肚皮。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 三对夫妇端坐着，被纵向破开了腹部，嗤啦一下挖开了肚皮。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Le tre coppie erano state messe là, con i loro stomaci lacerati verticalmente, strappati con un gyuiiiiiiigubaaa.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): I sei individui sposati fra loro erano stati posti quasi in maniera votiva, con i loro stomaci aperti mediante un taglio verticale, tranciati con un― gyuiiiigupaaa..
Turkish (TR): Üç çift, karınları dikey olarak yarılmış bir şekilde, oraya yerleştirilmişti.

Steam (ST): So many snacks had been stuffed in there, pulpy, squishy.
Umineko Project (UP): Lots and lots of sweets had been stuffed in there, pulpy, pugyurubugyu.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Many sweets had been stuffed in there, pulpy, squishy.
PC Japanese (JP): そこにお菓子をたくさんたくさん詰め込まれて、ぐちゃぐちゃぷぎゅるぶぎゅ。
Russian (RU): Куча сладостей была набита в них, мясистых, мягких.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Montes e montes de doces haviam sido estufados ali, polposos, pugyurubugyu.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在這之中塞進了好多好多糖果點心，黏黏糊糊，唏里嘩啦。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在这之中塞进了好多好多糖果点心，黏黏糊糊，唏里哗啦。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Furono riempiti in quel posto con molti dolci, polposo, viscido
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Furono colmati con vagonate di dolcetti, tutti polposi e schiacciati.
Turkish (TR): İçlerine de bol miktarda şeker tıkıştırılmıştı, posalı, ve yumuşacık.

Steam (ST): Blood and guts and sweets were overflowing onto the floor, ...bloodstained, sticky, sticky, sloppy, pulpy, sweet snacks that made your fingers stick together, gummy, gummy, aaah, but stained with entrails, sloppy, pulpy! What was that I stepped on just now, that didn't feel like a candy or a cookie or soda or a chocolate!
Umineko Project (UP): Blood and guts and sweets were overflowing onto the floor, ......blood‐stained, sticky, sticky, sloppy, pulpy, sweet candy stuck to each finger, gummy, gummy, aaah, but it's stained with their entrails, sloppy, pulpy! What was that I stepped on just now, that didn't feel like a candy or a cookie or a fizzy lemon sweet or a chocolate!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Blood and guts and sweets were overflowing onto the floor, ......bloodstained, sticky, sticky, sloppy, pulpy, sweet candy stuck to each finger, gummy, gummy, aaah, but it's stained with their entrails, sloppy, pulpy! What was that I stepped on just now, that didn't feel like a candy or a cookie or soda or a chocolate!
PC Japanese (JP): 血と内臓とお菓子を床に溢れ出した、……血まみれでべとべとぐちゃぐちゃ、甘いお菓子が指と指に張り付いてねとねとした、あぁでも臓物まみれでぐちゃぐちゃり！　今、踏みつけたものは何、飴でもクッキーでもラムネでもチョコレートでもない踏み応え！！
Russian (RU): Кровь, внутренности и конфеты были свалены на полу... всё в крови...липкие, липкие, испачканные, мясистые, сладкие конфеты, прилипшие к каждому пальцу, тянучие‐тянучие, а‐а‐ах, но ведь они запачканы их внутренностями, испачканы, мякотью! Предмет, на который я только что наступила, по ощущениям был ни конфетой, ни печеньем, ни баночкой с содовой, ни шоколадкой!
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Sangue, tripas e doces estavam vazando no piso, ......manchados de sangue, grudentos, grudentos, enlameados, polposos, balas doces, presas em cada dedo, pegajoso, pegajoso, aaah, está manchado com as entranhas deles, enlameado, polposo! No que foi que eu pisei ainda pouco, aquilo não parecia uma bala, um biscoito, uma {i:ramune} ou um chocolate!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 血、內臟、糖果溢到了地板上，……沾著鮮血，濕濕嗒嗒黏黏糊糊，甜甜的糖黏黏搭搭地粘在了他們手指之間，啊啊不過到處是內臟，已是一塌糊塗！此刻我踩到的是什麼？腳下的感觸，既不是糖也不是餅乾也不是汽水更不是巧克力！！
Chinese Simplified (CN): 血、内脏、糖果溢到了地板上，……沾着鲜血，湿湿嗒嗒黏黏糊糊，甜甜的糖黏黏搭搭地粘在了他们手指之间，啊啊不过到处是内脏，已是一塌糊涂！此刻我踩到的是什么？脚下的感触，既不是糖也不是饼干也不是汽水更不是巧克力！！
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Sangue, budella e dolci straripavano sul pavimento... macchiato di sangue, appiccicoso, appiccicoso, viscido, polposo, dolci caramelle attaccate ad ogni dito, gommose, gommose, aaah, ma è macchiato dalle loro viscere, viscide, polpose! Cos'è quello che ho appena calpestato, non mi ha dato la sensazione di caramella, né di biscotto, né di seltz né di cioccolato!
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Sul pavimento era stato riversato sangue, budella e dolcetti...  Erano sanguinolenti, vischiosi, appiccicosi, brodosi, polposi, dolcetti zuccherini appiccicati sulle dita, così collosi, viscosi, aaah, ma erano macchiati dalle loro viscere, ed erano brodose, carnose! Cos'avevo calpestato, quello che avevo pestato non mi dava l'impressione di essere una caramella, un biscotto, una pasticca al limone o del cioccolato!
Turkish (TR): Yere kan, bağırsak ve tatlılar taşmış, ......kanla kaplanmış, yapışkan, vıcık vıcık, ıslak, posalı, her parmağa yapıştırılmış tatlı şekerler, yapış yapış, yapış yapış, aaah, iç organlarla kaplanmış, sırılsıklam, hamurumsu! Az önce üzerine bastığım şey de neydi, şeker ya da kurabiye, jelibon ya da çikolata gibi hissettirmedi!

Steam (ST): Aaaaaaaaaaaaaah, I'm scared what did I step on I can't even look at the bottom of my foot!!
Umineko Project (UP): Aaaaaaaaaaaaaah, I'm so scared I can't even look at the bottom of my foot to see what I stepped on!!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=ST]
PC Japanese (JP): あぁあああぁ私は恐ろしくて何を踏んづけたのか足の裏を見ることもできないッ！！
Russian (RU): А‐а‐а‐а‐а‐а‐а‐а‐а‐а‐а‐а‐а‐ах, меня охватывает ужас при мысли о том, на что же я наступила, и я даже не могу посмотреть под ноги!

Steam (ST): Rosa's wild thoughts tried as best they could to escape her throat with a loud voice that was neither a scream nor a roar...
Umineko Project (UP): Rosa's wild thoughts tried as best they could to escape her throat with a loud voice that was neither a scream nor a roar...

Steam (ST): If a word so tied to reality hadn't come out of Gohda's mouth, Rosa and the rest would probably have found themselves unable to escape that nightmarish party even now.
Umineko Project (UP): If a word tied to reality like "police" hadn't come out of Gohda's mouth, Rosa and the rest would probably still have been unable to escape this nightmarish party.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If a word tied to reality, like police, hadn't come out of Gohda's mouth, Rosa and the rest would probably still be unable to escape this nightmarish party.
PC Japanese (JP): 郷田の口から、警察という現実的な単語が出なかったら、楼座たちは未だにこの悪夢のようなパーティから抜け出せなかっただろう。
Russian (RU): Если бы эти приближенные к реальности слова о полиции не слетели с губ Годы, Роза и остальные, возможно, так бы и не смогли вырваться из этого кошмарного праздника.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se uma palavra ligada à realidade como "polícia" não tivesse saído da boca de Gohda, Rosa e os outros provavelmente ainda não teriam sido capazes de escapar daquela festa kafkiana.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se eles não dissessem "polícia" "polícia", em voz alta, ......parecia que outro assento seria posto nesta festa demoníaca e oferecido a eles...!!

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Parecia que seus próprios estômagos estavam sendo desconfortavelmente preenchidos por dentro!! Ribombando, agitando... Certamente era porque as balas estavam começando a derramar de seus estômagos!!

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Sentì la pancia iniziare ad espandersi, facendole del male!! Gorgogliava, si agitava... Sicuramente era perché i dolcetti stavano per straripare dal suo ventre!!

Steam (ST): After watching them leave, ......Rosa once again stared at her siblings, with whom she'd spent good times and bad, and their partners. Though there could be nothing more tragic than this scene, ...for some reason, she was tempted to describe these fantastical deaths as beautiful......
Umineko Project (UP): After watching them leave, ...............Rosa once again fixedly cast her eyes upon her siblings, who had been through life's joys and sorrows with her, and their partners. ......Even though there could be nothing more tragic, ...for some reason, their fantastical deaths tempted her...to describe them as beautiful.........
Original Witch Hunt (OG): After watching them leave, ............Rosa once again fixedly cast her eyes upon those fantastical deaths of her siblings and their partners with a mixture of pleasure and pain. Even though there could be nothing more tragic, ...for some reason, she wanted to describe it as beautiful.........
PC Japanese (JP): 楼座はそれを見届けてから、……………苦楽を共にしてきた兄弟とその伴侶たちの、……悲惨この上ないのに、…なぜか美しいと形容してしまいたくなる、幻想的な死を、もう一度まじまじと目にするのだった………。
Russian (RU): Затем, проводив их взглядом... Роза снова пристально посмотрела на сцену фантастических смертей своих братьев и сестры со смесью наслаждения и боли. Даже несмотря на то, что нельзя было представить ничего более трагичного... По какой то причине ей хотелось охарактеризовать эту сцену как завораживающе красивую...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Depois de vê‐los sair,...............Rosa mais uma vez direcionou seu olhar aos seus irmãos, que estiveram com ela nas alegrias e tristezas da vida, e seus parceiros. ......Mesmo que não pudesse haver nada mais trágico, ...por alguma razão, suas mortes fantásticas tentavam‐na...a descrevê‐las como lindas.........
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 目送完他們出去的樓座，……………將與自己同甘共苦至今的哥哥姐姐，和他們的伴侶們，……那明明已是悲慘至極…卻又不知為何想將之形容為美麗的，幻想般的死相，再一次深深看在了眼裡………。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 目送完他们出去的楼座，……………将与自己同甘共苦至今的哥哥姐姐，和他们的伴侣们，……那明明已是悲惨至极…却又不知为何想将之形容为美丽的，幻想般的死相，再一次深深看在了眼里………。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Dopo averli visti andar via... Rosa ancora una volta fissò quella così fantasiosa morte dei suoi fratelli e dei loro compagni con un misto di piacere e dolore. Nonostante non ci potesse essere niente di più tragico... per qualche ragione, la voleva descrivere come bella... come uno spettacolo stupendo...
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Dopo averli visti andar via... Rosa volse ancora una volta il suo sguardo verso i suoi fratelli, con cui aveva condiviso gioie e dolori, e i loro compagni... e nonostante non potesse esserci nulla di più tragico... per qualche ragione, era tentata di descrivere la loro morte surreale... come uno spettacolo stupendo...
Turkish (TR): Onların gidişini izledikten sonra Rosa gözlerini bir kez daha, ...............hayatın sevinçlerini ve üzüntülerini kendisiyle birlikte yaşamış olan kardeşlerine ve onların eşlerine dikti. ......Bundan daha trajik bir şey olamayacağı halde, ...nedense onların fantastik ölümleri...onu bunları güzel olarak tanımlamaya itiyordu.........

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "...Well, even I was half-asleep, so I'm not too sure, but I get the feeling that, in the early morning, Aunt Rosa came in and fished around in Maria's handbag."
Umineko Project (UP): "......Well, I was half‐asleep so I'm not too confident. But I get the feeling that, at dawn, Auntie Rosa came in and fished around in Maria's handbag."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Well, I was half-asleep so I'm not too confident, but I get the feeling that, at dawn, Rosa oba-san came in and fished around in Maria's handbag."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……まぁ、俺も寝惚けてたから自信はねぇんだが。明け方に楼座叔母さんが入ってきて、真里亞の手提げカバンを漁ってるような気がしたんだよ」
Russian (RU): "......Ну, я был таким сонным, что твёрдо поручиться не могу, но у меня сложилось ощущение, будто на рассвете пришла тётя Роза и начала рыться в сумке Марии."

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Beh, ero mezzo addormentato, quindi non ne sono troppo sicuro, ma ho la sensazione che, all'alba, Rosa oba-san sia entrata e abbia frugato nella borsetta di Maria."

Steam (ST): Battler vaguely remembered Rosa entering the cousins' room. Also, when Maria woke up before the rest of them, she'd started rampaging around, saying that someone had opened the envelope she'd been keeping safe.
Umineko Project (UP): Battler vaguely remembered Rosa entering the cousins' room. And Maria, who had woken up first, had started rampaging around, saying that someone had opened the envelope that she had been keeping safe.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Battler vaguely remembered Rosa entering the cousins' room. And Maria, who had woken up first, had started rampaging around, saying that someone had opened an envelope that she had been keeping safe.
PC Japanese (JP): 戦人は楼座がいとこ部屋に入ってきたのをぼんやり覚えていた。そして、一番に起きた真里亞が、大事にしまっていた封筒が破かれていると言って、大騒ぎを始めた。
Russian (RU): Баттлер смутно помнил Розу, вошедшую в комнату кузенов. И Мария, проснувшаяся первой, была вне себя, твердя, что кто‐то вскрыл конверт, доверенный ей на хранение.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Battler vagamente lembrava de Rosa entrando no quarto dos primos. E Maria, que havia acordado primeiro, tinha começado a esbravejar por aí, dizendo que alguém tinha aberto o envelope que ela estava mantendo seguro.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 戰人隱約記得樓座進過堂兄妹房間。而第一個起床的真里亞，也說著自己收得好好的信封被撕破了，大吵了起來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 战人隐约记得楼座进过堂兄妹房间。而第一个起床的真里亚，也说着自己收得好好的信封被撕破了，大吵了起来。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Battler ricordò vagamente Rosa che entrava nella stanza dei cugini. E Maria, che si era svegliata per prima, aveva iniziato a infuriarsi, dicendo che qualcuno aveva aperto la lettera che stava tenendo al sicuro.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Battler aveva una vaga memoria di Rosa che entrava nella stanza dei cugini.{n}E Maria, che si era svegliata per prima, aveva iniziato un gran baccano, dicendo che qualcuno aveva strappato la busta che aveva messo al sicuro con gran cura...

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica

Umineko Project (UP): "......A letter from the Golden Witch... I wonder what was inside."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...Una lettera della Strega Dorata... Chissa cosa c'era al suo interno."

Speaker: Ushiromiya George
Steam (ST): "I don't know. ...But that envelope was for Grandfather's personal use, and it had the Ushiromiya family crest on it. ......Whatever was inside it must've had some connection to the family conference."
Umineko Project (UP): "Who knows. ...But that envelope was one with the Ushiromiya family crest on it, for Grandfather's personal use. ............It's hard to believe that what was in there doesn't have anything to do with the family conference."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "I don't know. ...But that envelope was for Grandfather's personal use, and it had the Ushiromiya family crest on it. ............It's hard to believe that what was in there doesn't have anything to do with the family conference."
PC Japanese (JP): 「わからないね。…でも、あの封筒はお祖父さまが親書に使う、右代宮家の家紋の入ったものだった。………親族会議と無関係なものが入っていたとは考え難いね。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「わからないね。…でも、あの封筒はお祖父さまが親書に使う、右代宮家の家紋の入ったものだった。………親族会議と無関係なものが入っていたとは考え難いね」
Russian (RU): "Я не знаю. ...Но это личный конверт дедушки и он помечен гербом семьи Уширомия. ............Очень трудно предположить, что это никак не связано с собранием семьи."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Quem sabe. ...Mas aquele envelope era um daqueles com o brasão da família Ushiromiya nele, para uso pessoal do vovô. ............É difícil de acreditar que o que estava ali não tenha nada a ver com a conferência familiar."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「不知道。…不過，那是一封爺爺會用在親筆信上面的，配有右代宮家家徽的信封。………很難想像裡面會裝著與親族會議完全無關的東西。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「不知道。…不过，那是一封爷爷会用在亲笔信上面的，配有右代宫家家徽的信封。………很难想象里面会装着与亲族会议完全无关的东西。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Non lo so. ... Ma quella busta era per uso personale del Nonno, e aveva su di essa il simbolo della famiglia Ushiromiya. ... È difficile credere che ciò che c'è dentro non abbia nulla a che fare con la conferenza di famiglia."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Non ne ho idea... Ma quel tipo di busta è usata da nostro nonno per scopi ufficiali, e su di essa c'era il simbolo della famiglia Ushiromiya... Mi riesce difficile credere che il suo contenuto non avesse nulla a che fare con la riunione di famiglia."
Turkish (TR): "Kim bilir. ...Ama o zarf, üzerinde Ushiromiya ailesinin arması olan bir zarftı ve büyükbabamın şahsi kullanımı içindi. ............İçindekilerin aile konferansıyla bir ilgisi olmadığına inanmak zor."

Steam (ST): She hadn't let anyone touch it, but yesterday, Maria had shown that envelope off to Battler and the rest a whole lot. ...So they remembered it well.
Umineko Project (UP): She hadn't let anyone touch it, but yesterday, Maria had bragged a lot about the envelope to Battler and the rest. ...So they remembered it well.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She hadn't let anyone touch it, but yesterday, Maria had bragged a lot about the envelope to Battler and the rest....So they remembered it well.
PC Japanese (JP): 誰にも触らせなかったが、真里亞は昨日、戦人たちに封筒をさんざん自慢していた。…だから彼らはそれをよく記憶していた。
Russian (RU): Она не позволяла никому к нему притронуться, но вчера Мария долго хвасталась этим конвертом перед Баттлером и остальными. ...Поэтому они хорошо запомнили его.

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Lei non aveva lasciato che nessuno la toccasse, ma ieri, Maria si era vantata molto per via della lettera con Battler e gli altri. ... Perciò loro se lo ricordavano bene.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "...Well, if you're right, it'd have to be pretty important... ...Why would this mighty witch give something that important to Maria? ...I don't get it."
Umineko Project (UP): "......If you're right, George‐aniki, it sounds pretty important. ...But if it was so important, why did the witch give it to Maria? ...I don't have a clue."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......If you're right, George-aniki, it looks pretty important. ...However, if it was so important, why did the witch give it to Maria? ...I don't have a clue."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……譲治の兄貴の言う通りなら、相当重要なものらしいが。…しかし、そんな大事なものを、どうして魔女さまは真里亞に渡したんだろうな？　…さっぱりだぜ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……譲治の兄貴の言う通りなら、相当重要なものらしいが。…しかし、そんな大事なものを、どうして魔女さまは真里亞に渡したんだろうな？　…さっぱりだぜ」
Russian (RU): "......Если ты прав, Джордж‐аники, конверт и его содержимое должны играть важную роль. ...Но если письмо было настолько важным, почему ведьма дала его Марии? ...Я даже не представляю."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Se você estiver certo, ele parece ser bem importante. ...Mas, se era tão importante, por que a bruxa deu ele para a Maria? ...Não faço ideia."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……要是如让治哥所说，那这就应该是个相当重要的东西啊。…可是，如此重要的东西，魔女夫人为什么要交给真里亚呢？…完全搞不懂啊。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Se tu hai ragione, George-aniki, sembra piuttosto importante. ... Tuttavia, se lo è così tanto, perché la strega l'ha data a Maria? ... Non so che pensare."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...Se è come dici tu, fratellone George, sembra una roba piuttosto seria... Ma se è così tanto importante, perché la somma strega l'ha consegnata a Maria...? Non ne ho alcuna idea."

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Pois então. ...Eu acabei de acordar e então vim para cá. Temo não saber informar."

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Oh, cielo. Sono arrivato adesso dopo essermi svegliato poco fa. Non lo saprei dire sul momento..."
